column3:
Celebrating people, our planet, and organic products

Woodlands Organic is a family-owned organic farm located in Charlevoix County, Michigan. Currently, we brew authentic USDA Organic-certified kombucha. You can always expect refreshing, pure, and organic kombucha and a wellspring of vitality.

How we do it

Our Kombucha begins with steeped, organic black and green tea and organic sugar. Once brewed, the tea is combined with an organic symbiotic culture (SCOBY) and then ferments until ready. After, we add fresh, organic whole fruit and continue to ferment. This process happens with the finest, organic fruits and herbs available, under highly controlled conditions of light, temperature, and air. This combination allows us to produce the best Kombucha available!

The Woodlands is an 80-acre organic farm located in Charlevoix County, Michigan, which has been in our family for over 70 years. Our owner Glenn Golonka has 5 daughters, each with their unique personalities. His amazing daughters and their unique personalities inspired him to create Woodlands Organic Kombucha.

column3:
Our Story

Rogie and I co-founded Sidekick Soda at the beginning of 2023 after many months of planning and product development. Our goal was to create a tasty, healthy and â€˜better-for-youâ€™ soda that stood apart from the traditional high-sugar, artificially sweetened and often tasteless drinks.

We use real fruit, raw organic Apple Cider Vinegar and New Zealand Honey to sweeten our sodas. Each Sidekick is packed with flavour, Gluten Free and All-Natural â€“ the perfect drink for any Hero (like you).

Sidekick Soda is our take on the classic drinking â€˜shrubâ€™ that my Mum used to make for me over 40 years ago. Mum knew the health benefits of apple cider vinegar on the gut.

Both of us are animal lovers. I donâ€™t remember a time when my house wasnâ€™t full of re-homed and rescue cats and dogs. Because part of our journey in business is about helping others it was a no-brainer to team up with Paw Justice, a New Zealand based animal charity supporting rescue groups with a Foodbank, emergency surgery fund and education program to teach the young about animal care and welfare. We hope our donations from Sidekick Soda will make a difference.

Â 

During the Great Depression in the United States of America, soda fountains were a mainstay of social life. People would walk into a pharmacy instead of a bar to order a Two Cents plain (sparkling water) or sparkling water with flavored syrup at the cost of Three Cents. Inspired by this story as well as the evolution of carbonation, three spirited bartenders utilized their experience, scientific knowledge and expertise to create the perfect premium cocktail mixers with just the right amount fizziness and so the journey began.


Premium Greek Beverages

Three Cents Premium Artisanal Beverages were born out of the passion of four men with completely different backgrounds who decided to study, experiment, test and finally advance the production process of the original soda fountain machine. After a long experimental process, Three Cents has managed to capture and sustain all the flavor with just the right amount of bubbles and so the first Three Cents Greek premium beverages were introduced to the market.

Flavors

Pink Grapefruit Soda

Mandarin & Bergamot Soda

Sparkling Lemonade

Lemon Tonic

Cherry Soda

Ginger Beer

Two Cents Plain Tonic Water

Aegean Tonic Water

100% Natural

ï»¿ï»¿Made with spring water and 100% natural ingredients, with no preservatives, artificial flavors, aromas or colors. Three Cents Beverages are also suitable vegans and those following a gluten free diet.

A Premium Soda Made with the Highest Quality Ingredients

At Hana, weâ€™re committed to crafting our beverages using only the finest ingredients. We believe in using only the purest, raw form of real juice to create our drinks, just as nature intended. We first start by blending our juicy organic lemons from Spain & zesty yuzu from Japan. We then add Achill Island Irish Sea salt to enhance the flavours & draw out their sweetness. To perfect the balance, we add a touch of organic sugar cane and stevia for sweetness. Nothing more, nothing less.

Â 

Carefully Crafted

Gently sparkling, this premium soft drink is the perfect blend of unique fruit with organic lemon juice, fresh yuzu juice and Irish sea salt. Pure, raw & refreshing!

Our Story

To find the best flavours, you need to search for the best ingredients. Join us on a journey of exploration as we travel from East to West in search of the worldâ€™s finest ingredients. .

Our journey begins in Japan, the easternmost country in Asia, as we discover the best that nature has to offer.

Sparkling Lemon & Yuzu Craft Soda x 12

Gently sparkling, this premium soft drink is the perfect blend of unique fruit with organic Lemon juice, fresh Yuzu juice and, a small pinch of Achill Island Irish Sea salt. Its low in sugar and calories, with only 33 calories per bottle.

Carefully crafted & bottled in Ireland, the taste is Pure, Raw Refreshing!

Vegan

Our soft drinks are suitable for both vegans and vegetarians. We take pride in using only real juice as the core ingredient in our beverages, without any animal-derived ingredients. So, you can enjoy our drinks with the confidence that they align with vegan and vegetarian dietary preferences.

Nutritional information

Each bottle of our craft soda contains just 5.25 grams of sugar and a mere 33 calories per bottle. Plus, weâ€™re proud to say that our drinks are packed with 100% of your daily recommended vitamin C intake, thanks to the real juice we use to create them. So, you can sip away knowing youâ€™re making a smart and tasty choice!

Environmentally friendly & sustainable

We use organic ingredients in the production of our beverages, promoting healthier farming practices and reducing the impact of harmful chemicals on the environment.

Moreover, our glass bottles are designed to be returnable, supporting a circular economy model. While Ireland currently lacks the infrastructure for bottle collection and cleaning, we are proactively pursuing the establishment of a robust bottle return system in the future. We are committed to building the groundwork for a highly sustainable brand, one that envisions reusing our glass bottles in our production cycle up to 10 times.

Gluten freeÂ 

Our soft drinks are completely gluten-free. We prioritize using only real juice and ingredients that do not contain gluten, making our beverages suitable for those with gluten sensitivities or dietary restrictions. You can enjoy our drinks with confidence, knowing they are free from gluten-related concerns.

Caffeine free

Our soft drinks do not contain caffeine. Weâ€™re all about the natural goodness of real juice without any added stimulants. So, you can enjoy our beverages for a caffeine-free refreshment experience.

Â

PRODUCT INFO

MADE FROM 100% ORGANIC AROMATIC COCONUT NECTAR

Copra's Sparkling Coconut Nectar draws both its sweet and sour notes form the very same source. We combine fresh and fermented nectar from coconut palms into one drink for a perfect balance of flavors. With a low glycemic index and a wealth of minerals and amino acids, this floral duo is an effervescent addition to your wellness arsenal.

WHAT IS SPARKLING COCONUT NECTAR?

Our Sparkling Coconut Nectar is derived from pure, organic nectar bled from the flower of young Thai coconut trees in Western Thailand. The nectar is naturally fermented over several months until it turns to cider and eventually nonalcoholic vinegar. we add carbonated water and a touch of coconut nectar to turn this superfood into a refreshing, delicious drink to power your busy lifestyle.

BENEFITS

Sparkling Coconut Nectar introduces beneficial bacteria in your gut to aid digestion, help you better absorb nutrients and strengthen your immune system. Coconut sap in particular contains 17 amino acids necessary for essential body function and is rich in minerals.

  • 17 Amino Acids
  • 65 minerals
  • Low Glycemic Index
  • Crafted from coconut nectar & vinegar
  • Non-GMO Project Verified

PRODUCT SPECIFICATIONS
ORIGIN Ratchaburi Province, Thailand
INGREDIENTS Coconut flower nectar, Organic coconut flower vinegar
FLAVOR Sparkling Cider Vinegar
APPEARANCE Slightly cloudy, brown liquid
THICKNESS Liquid
SHELFÂ LIFE 75 days Refrigerated
PACKAGING Glass Bottle
STORAGE Ambient, don't store above 35 degrees Celsius
AROMA Sweet and sour, light smell of vinegar
TEXTURE
 Sparkling beverage, similar to a kombucha
HANDLING Ground

column3:
Our Story

Michael Dunne's passion for this product emerged from never having consumed traditional soft drinks as a child. By crafting his own healthy, thirst-quenching, sparkling beverage, he could enjoy the pleasures of a real soda, without the guilt of sugar or artificial flavours. As a trained chef, Michael created a "better for you" drink that was made from real ingredients, without artificial flavours, that has all the goodness of apple cider vinegar. Heal Thy Soda was born in his kitchen, and now Michael can share his passion with the world.


Social Goals

Our aim is to change the way people think about consuming sugar drinks. We want them, especially children, to be educated on the negative impacts of sugar on their health, and to encourage them to seekÂ healthy alternatives. We hope to make people aware of these impacts from an early age.

Flavour Profile

Raspberry & Rose

These flavours work beautifully together with a soft almost spring feeling, like walking through a rose garden. It's light, fresh and the perfect drink if you enjoy subtle floral flavours. This is perfect to drink with friends at a picnic, on a warm summer's day.

Pineapple Lime & Mint

Like a well-crafted mojito, this tangy fresh pineapple flavour is perfectly matched with fragrant mint leaves and a hint of lime juice, leaving you with a feeling of being in a Mexican poolside retreat.

Passionfruit, Peach & Berry

Sparking the inner child in everyone with this take on passionfruit soda, we have ramped up the flavour with the added splash of raspberries.

Our Product

  • 100% real fruit-infused soda with only 4 natural ingredients and no sugar

  • Less than 9 calories per bottle

  • Lightly sparkling with the real fresh fruit taste in every sip

  • ACV Mother, good for your health

  • More interesting flavours to follow
column36: Heal Thy Organic Soda - Organic Soda Pops

column3:
Our Story

Joe Meinhardt is the founder and owner of Joeâ€™s Organic Syrup. His journey in the organic syrup business is one of passion and perseverance. He began his career in the coffee business with Coffee Bean International out of Portland, Oregon in 1988. In 2007 disaster struck and he lost his wife to cancer. He was left to raise two young children alone and needed flexible hours to be there for them.

Ever the entrepreneur, Joe began repairing coffee roasting and brewing equipment and also teaching others how to roast and blend coffee. In 2008, Joe had a customer ask him to formulate and produce some coffee syrups for his chain of coffee stores in Salem. Joe was intrigued by the request but also knew he did not want to produce a syrup that had artificial sweeteners, dyes or preservatives.

With the assistance of his ten-year-old son, Joel, they began experimenting with All Natural recipes in their kitchen! Within a few months they were selling a line of Premium Natural coffee syrups. Inspired by increasing sales, Joe began to build his own processing plant from scratch. (A man of many talents, Joe is also an accomplished engineer and electrician.)

The plant was up and running by 2013. By now Joe had a line of twelve All Natural syrup flavors, and his list of customers was growing, so Joe decided it was time to pursue the process to be Certified Organic. He completed the complex certification Process in June of 2013. Today Joeâ€™s Organic Syrup has a variety of 22 flavors.

We are a family business and our employees are part of our family. Joe makes sure we all maintain his high standards. We take pride in our syrup and taste-test every batch to make sure itâ€™s not just Certified Organic, but also certified delicious.

column3:
Our mission is to save the planet one drop at a time.

Asarasi Sparkling Tree Water is a 100% plant-sourced, tree-drawn sparkling water, harvested from the sap of maple trees. Maple sap is 97% pure water and 3% maple sugar. When the maple sugar molecule is removed from the sap by reverse osmosis filtration, two products are created; maple syrup and pure tree water!
Each year, up to 1 Billion gallons of pure, naturally tree-filtered water is harmlessly extracted from living maple treesâ€”an amount that could help replace the existing bottled water industry that exists today. Asarasi has pioneered a proprietary process to collect, carbonate, flavor and deliver this incredible byproduct in nine delicious flavors of organic sparkling tree water straight to you!
By sourcing our water from living trees, Asarasi has created the worldâ€™s only sustainable and renewable, USDA organic, sparkling bottled water while helping family farmers become more profitable and helping alleviate the stress on the groundwater table from human overconsumption.
Looking for a warm, fun activity to do with his daughter in the middle of a Vermont winter, Asarasi founder and CEO Adam Lazar decided to attend a maple farm open house. As the farmer went through the process of producing maples syrups and maple products, Adam witnessed thousands of gallons of sugar-free maple sap water being discarded. AfterÂ asking the farmer why he wasn't utilizing this pure, tree-filtered water and why his hard work was being unnecessarily thrown away, he learned that maple syrup producers use only 3% of the sap collected to make syrup and maple products. The remaining 97% is pure tree-drawn water that is not utilized. The idea was born that tree water was a new plant-source of incredibly pure, organic water that had never been tapped and Asarasi was born. Each year, up to one billion gallons of pure, naturally filtered water is harmlessly extracted from living maple-trees, an amount that couldÂ helpÂ replace the existing bottled water industry that exists today. AsarasiÂ  has pioneered a way to carbonate, store and deliver nine delicious flavors of organic sparkling tree water straight to you! By sourcing our water from living trees, Asarasi has created the world's only sustainable and renewable, bottled organic sparkling drinking water.

column3:
The Organic Drink Co's signature Ginger Beer is brewed naturally from local organic products. The flavour of this iconic beverage is likened to the style made by grandma underneath the house. You know, the ones where bottles occasionally explode. Home-brewed, home-grown, natural and fresh. But OMG delicious! We take out the risk factor and give you the refreshment.

Based in Byron Bay and founded in 2015, The Organic Drink Co set out to do things differently. Bloody great tasting, refreshing beverages, made the old fashioned way, by hand, with no added chemicals, preservatives or additives.

Low in sugar, these bottles of liquid goodness are brewed naturally using the best ethically sourced, quality organic ingredients,Â no artificialÂ flavours or syrups. we promise you'll taste the difference.Â 

Committed to doing things differently, The Organic Drink Co are proud to partner withÂ 1% for the PlanetÂ andÂ CO2nsensus. You can also read more about our commitment to sustainabilityÂ here.

TheÂ ARTONICÂ collection of premium organic soda & mixers were created by three beverageÂ professionalsÂ from the Cognac region of France, where â€œExcellence-in-a-Glassâ€ has for centuries set the gold standard for the making of fine spirits. The savoir-faire intrinsic to outstanding beverage production is so far-reaching in Cognac that the line between what is art and what is artisanal has been all but eliminated. This expertise is so deeply woven into our regionâ€™s cultural identity that more than 50% of the worldâ€™s super premium spirits are produced here in what is now known as â€œSpirits Valleyâ€.

As long-standing participants in this regionâ€™s activity, we were well positioned and uniquely qualified to develop ourÂ exceptionalÂ mixers. We haveÂ adapted our work methods toÂ applyÂ the same specialized and qualitative approaches practiced in spirit production to create tonics and sodas made to respect andÂ harmonize withÂ the signature aromatic profiles of the finest spirits.Â 

TheÂ ARTONICÂ brand represents the fundamental connection between artisan and artistâ€”craft and artâ€”and the savoir-faire, passion and humanity that define and drive their creativity.Â ARTONICÂ is the fruit of the collaboration between an artisan and an artistÂ who haveÂ combined their inspiration and skills to create a line of mixers which, thanks to their original and singular flavor profiles, are inspiring bartenders and chefs to create cocktails, mocktails and food pairings that are uniquely inventive. column2: Casamara Club All Natural Soft Drinks
column3:
Each of our drinks starts with real ingredients, sourced from all over the world, minimally processed in small batches. There are no industrialized â€œnatural flavorsâ€ or alternative sweeteners in any of our drinks â€“ no stevia, no monkfruit, no aspartame, no erythritol. We prefer real botanical extracts because "natural flavors" end up tasting pretty artificial, as if their edges have been sanded down for mass appeal. We use real ingredients because they have character. They can still surprise us.

We work and rework our recipes for months, searching for new, unique flavors and aromas somewhere on the borderÂ betweenÂ familiar and truly extraordinary. We carefully adjust the balance of ingredients one drop at a time, until they start to meld and twist,Â taking on a life of their own.Â That's howÂ we know weâ€™ve found something special enough to share with you.Â 

We do this because we thinkÂ soft drinksÂ should be as elegantÂ and asÂ preciselyÂ made as any good glass of wine, beer, or spirit â€“ and as playful as a soda.

column3:
Real Organic Kola

Kola with a K? Well of course â€“ thatâ€™s how kola nut is spelled!

The unmistakable flavour of a kola drink is achieved through careful selection and balancing of a number of aromatic ingredients. At TOÌˆRST we make our REAL KOLA using twelve different fruits, herbs and spices to create a complex yet harmonic soda based around the traditional west African kola nut.

The round caramel notes from unrefined cane sugar creates a foundation for flavours, further complemented by sweet spices such as cinnamon, vanilla and liquorice. Fresh citrus fruits lend a bright freshness which all together balances the aromatic and spicy notes from kola nut, nutmeg and fresh ginger.

Serve REAL KOLA over ice on any occasion when you crave a great tasting soda crafted from highest quality ingredients. Still a soda, just better.

SustainabilityÂ 

The strive for sustainable development is a continuous process involving the actions of countries, companies and individuals alike. At TÃ–RST we strive to be at the very forefront regarding sustainability and to act as a role model within the food & beverage industry. Through careful consideration and action along the value chain, we ensure the broad and holistic grasp of sustainability work that we believe can be expected from a modern company.

column3:
In search of the best ingredients for our sodas, we set out on a promising journey. We visited farms, climbed lemon and orange trees on the edge of a volcano and bit into the sour apple numerous times. At the end of the journey we found juicy sweet apples in the idyllic Zurich Unterland and bright yellow lemons and fiery red blood oranges in sunny Sicily. The tasty organic fruits make our sodas the perfect thirst quencher and convince with natural and high-quality ingredients.

Apple Spritzer made with organic apple juice from the Zurich farmlands

To get the best apples in the world, we didnâ€™t have to travel far. In autumn, organic farmer Hans Brunner harvests juicy sweet apples on his farm in Steinmaur. The fresh apple juice mixed with water gives our sparkling organic spritzer a natural sweetness, without added sugar.Â 

Lemon & Ginger made with organic lemon juice from Sicily and organic ginger from Switzerland

When the leaves fall from the trees in autumn, the citrus gardens of Sicily glow in a bright yellow. The long awaited harvest time for lemons can begin. For our lemonade, the sun-ripened fruits are pressed directly after harvest. A touch of organic ginger from Switzerland, a little cane sugar and our organic soda tastes refreshing and like homemade.

Blood Orange & Ginger made with organic blood orange juice from Sicily and organic ginger from Switzerland

Our blood oranges grow at the foot of the volcano Etna in Sicily. Due to the high temperature differences in the winter months, the oranges get their strong, dark red colour. Rumour has it that the Arancia Rossa mentioned there is considered the juiciest and tastiest blood orange in the world. Its juice, pressed directly from the harvest, mixed with a hint of organic ginger from Switzerland and little cane sugar is the refreshment hit par excellence on warm summer days.

column3:
How It All Began

NYC is widely considered one of the most diverse cities in the world; with people, music, and FOOD from all over! After several years of cooking in some of the top restaurants in the city, Founder Alton But noticed that the non-alcoholic beverage pairings were always less than inspiring. NYC has some of the best Asian cuisine outside of Asia, only for the meals to be paired with the same old sodas and soft drinks that every other restaurant in the city carries.

What if you wanted something different? What if you wanted something authentic? What if you wanted an Asian drink to go with Asian food?

A year later in 2020, Alton and his team made it their mission to change this; They launched Moshi, a beverage brand made with unique Asian ingredients to pair with the Asian cuisine we all know and love.

Our Mission

Our mission is to highlight unique Asian flavors through an accessible and refreshing sparkling beverage in an antiquated space.

OUR INGREDIENTS

column3:
TÃ–RST organic sodas are uncomplicated products where the ingredients are kept as ethical, as natural and as few as possible. We use real cane sugar - lowly processed and rectified, organically farmed and fairly traded - and it tastes amazing! The pale straw-colorÂ with a rounded sweetness and its hints of caramel and sweet spices is the perfect choice as sweetening agent to lift the natural aromas from tangy citrus, sun ripened berries and sweet tropical spices.

Ingredient Sourcing:

Conscious sourcing of ingredients is the start of our product as we believe that a high-quality soda stems from the selection of high-quality ingredients. To live up to the standards of what we call a real soda means that the ingredients are kept as ethical, as natural, and as few as possible. TÃ–RST sodas are organic-, Fairtrade- and Ã„kta Vara certified and contain no aromas, preservatives or artificial colorings.

Organic:

The organic certification of TÃ–RST means that all ingredients are conforming to organic standards - they are cultivated without the usage of synthetic fertilizers, pesticides or GMO crops. Regular reviews by authorized organs ensure a product void of chemical residue and with greater concern of farmers and ecosystems alike.

Sustainability:

The strive for sustainable development is a continuous process involving the actions of countries, companies and individuals alike. At TÃ–RST we strive to be at the very forefront regarding sustainability and to act as a role model within the food & beverage industry. Through careful consideration and action along the value chain, we ensure the broad and holistic grasp of sustainability work that we believe can be expected from a modern company.

Fair Trade:Â 

Fairtrade focus on reducing inequalities in the global trade market by certification of produce from countries with extensive poverty. Guarantees of higher harvest prices, community premiums directed at long-term investments as well as supporting healthcare, education and infrastructure are aspects that strengthen the communities of small-scale farmers. By choosing a Fairtrade soda from TÃ–RST you ensure that everyone along the value chain is treated fair from an economical-, social- and environmental point of view.

Ã„kta Vara:

Ã„kta Vara is a certification that ensures that the products are free from additives, aromas and highly processed ingredients. Product information and ingredient declaration has to be transparent, not to mislead the consumer. By choosing a product with the Ã„kta Vara-mark you are thus ensured a genuine product that is honest and mindfully crafted.

Â 

Â

column3:
Our cola has all the natural benefits of cascara.

Cascara is the pulp of the coffee tree fruit. A natural, delicious and fair trade antioxidant that generates a new source of income for coffee producers while promoting sustainability and the circular economy by using the part of the coffee fruit that is normally discarded.

Ice Cascara Cola:

Unique and ethical, our drink gets itsÂ naturalÂ caffeine from the infusion of organic cascara, which is the pulp of the coffee berry.

More information:

Our cola has all the natural benefits of cascara, with no added sugars or sweeteners.
Except for those naturally present in the ingredients.

Ethics:

Promotes a sustainable circular economy with 20cts per bottle paid directly to certified organic producers. Generates a new source of income for farmers. Valuing this ingredient, too often considered as fruit waste, is our contribution to a circular economy and a better world.

Antioxidant:

Naturally contains antioxidants such as vitamin C, zinc and polyphenols that contribute to normal immune system function and protect cells from oxidative stress.

Ingredients:

Pure Swiss water infused with organic cascara (pulp and skin of Coffea arabica L. - South and Central America), organic grape concentrate (EU), carbon dioxide, acidifier (citric acid), antioxidant (ascorbic acid), natural cola flavours. Pasteurized.

Certification:

Certified Bio Inspecta CH - 006, Gluten Free, Swiss Water, Vegan.

column3:
No Artificial Flavors or Colors. Just Real.


We make all-natural juice based beverages that taste even better than they look.

HOW IT STARTED

I grew up on a fruit farm in Mexico. We moved to the US when I was 13. I always had a little entrepreneurial drive. When we saw an opportunity to create the company we jumped in feet first. We have had a lot of set backs and a great deal of challenges but we keep pushing forward. There is no reason to stop. Several years after we started our Soda company I came across a history book about my ancestors. The first Bowman that moved to Mexico established a store at the train station. Come to find out he was the first person to bring a soda fountain into Mexico.

WHAT WE OFFER

We manufacture an all-natural Juice based carbonated beverage. Itâ€™s a better option than normal high-fructose corn syrup drinks or artificially sweetened drinks. We use real ingredients that your body recognizes and can digest normally. Plus it tastes amazing! Our product is shelf stable and will last 9-12 months from the date of production. We DO NOT add any preservatives or artificial ingredients or flavors. The color and flavor only comes from the fruit it is made with.

column2: Good Wolf Probiotic Tonic & Water Kefir
column3:
Good Wolf Probiotic Tonics are water kefir based. They're fully fermented, plant based and non alcoholic. Nothing fake, ever! We carefully craft them in small batches to support your gut health, cognitive function and immunity. Cheers to that!

Our flavors

Ginger Lemon ~

Ginger Lemon Probiotic Tonic is our spicy spin on ginger ale. It's invigorating and refreshing! You'll appreciate all the gut healthy benefits of this modern celebration of a classic flavor, without tons of added sugar.

Hibiscus Bloom ~

An alluring tonic infused with real lavender, rose, and hibiscus. Floral notes, a touch of sweetness and balanced with acidity from cold pressed lemon juice. Treat yo'self if you're feeling gray and want to feel sunshiney.

Pina Colada ~

We are in love with this new school PiÃ±a Colada for many reasons. Perhaps a tropical pineapple and coconut taste is the vacation your taste buds have been longing for? This booze free golden wellness tonic will put you on the next flight to paradise. Take in all the allure of a PiÃ±a Colada without any of the booze!

Our story

Good Wolf began in 2016 by Keenan Smith and Danny Sheller. It was their dream to feed the good wolves of Portland. After a few years, Danny moved on to start another business and Keenan kept it going. He successfully grew Good Wolf into a respectable, organic beverage brand and a Portland, Oregon staple.

Then came Covid. Unfortunately, due to all the things, Keenan made the hard decision to sell the assets to Nathan and Casey Keane, who owned a tiny kombucha brewery called Kardia. Nathan and Casey began making kombucha years ago, to help with Nathanâ€™s gut health. Not surprisingly, it totally changed his life and erased nearly all of his gut problems! When Nathan met Keenan in early 2022, Keenan mentioned that he was looking to sell Good Wolf and Nathan LIT UP. His dad had told him and his siblings the story of two wolves as a kid!! The memories came flooding back. This couldn't be a coincidence. Nathan excitedly picked up his phone and called his dad. John is a long time successful business owner and was stoked to hear about this opportunity. He too caught his son's vision and helped Nathan and Casey buy Good Wolf!

Nathan and Casey Keane

Our goal has always and will always be to make the healthiest and best tasting beverages around and empower you to feed your good wolf!

Â

column3:
Sole Rosso organic soft drinks are joy,Â passion, great energyÂ and some of the bestÂ organic beveragesÂ on earth. MadeÂ according toÂ the most authenticÂ and healthyÂ Italian tradition.

Italian Blood Orange;

Made by mixing the renowned organic Italian red oranges of Sanduinello, Moro, and Tarocco. These varieties are rich in anthocyans and natural vitamins and hand picked at the perfect point of ripening and cold squeezed to preserve their natural and heady fragrance that is typical of this precious citrus fruit. This organic soft drink is 20% fruit juice.

Italian Blood Orange & Blueberry;

A deep red ruby color. This soft drink is the result of a union of organic blueberry with strong aromatic notes, renowned healthy properties, and the organic Italian blood oranges of Sanguinello, Moro, and Tarocco. These varieties are naturally rich in vitamins and antioxidants and are hand picked at the perfect point of ripeness and cold squeezed. This organic soft drink is 16% fruit juice.

Sicilian Lemon;

Sicily called "The land of lemons" where the sea and the volcanic nature of the area give this citrus fruit an incomparable aromatic note most likely not found in other parts of the world.Â  This drink is made by mixing organic Sicilian lemons rich in vitamin C and antioxidants. The lemons are hand picked at the perfect point of ripeness and cold squeezed to preserve the natural, pungent fragrance of the fruit. This organic soft drink is 16% fruit juice.

Pink Grapefruit;

This organic soft drink is made with precious organic pink grapefruit from the Mediterranean Basin. The delicate notes of the sugar are exalted by the lightly bitter aftertaste and the wonderful citrus fragrance. Ideal to enjoy just fresh and also excellent with cocktails. This organic soft drink is 16% fruit juice.

Organic Cola;

An organic cola with amber reflections and a endearing scent. This organic soft drink is enriched with the precious vanilla berries of Madagascar.

column3:
Doinâ€™ Good is at the heart of Lo BrosÂ 

From the drinks we make to how we turn up in the world. But maybe weâ€™ll save you the long version for now and letâ€™s just let the handy infographic do the talking!

We use the ancient process of fermentation to redirect energy as a force for good. Replacing sugars with living goodness.

Made from all natural ingredients

We use all natural, organic ingredients to create great products that are a delicious, better-for-you alternative to other drinks out there.

Positive change

We are using energy to transform the drinks industry - turning negatives into positives. Plans have been brewing and bubbling in the background - from the impacts of sugar to ways we can help the wellbeing of the planet too. Positive change is on the way!

Here is our vision

From the Bros who started it all, to the Doinâ€™ Good energy that brings our drinks to life - weâ€™re living proof of the community's power to make things happen.

It begins with the way we create our kombucha - using authentic fermentation to craft brew delicious, healthier organic drinks with vibrant flavors that are naturally low in sugar and alive with living cultures.

Next, that energy is transformed into the stand we make against the devious drinks industry and their sugar-loaded drinks.

Then before you know it, that Doin' Good energy is bubbling up and over with new life: a catalyst for positive change and a damn tasty drink too.

column3:
Indi & Co produce drinks using exclusively organic botanicals, following both artisanal maceration and distillation processes in 200 year old ancient copper stills. This is the only way to obtain the best flavors and unique aromas.
Flavor takes time to develop and we credit it all to our stillsâ€™ slow drip distillation.
We have shunned mass production, and automation, and gone back to the tradition of manual production, preserving the values of craftsmanship and the skill of artisans, leaving behind artificial methods and going back to nature.

Selection

We source every single organic botanical from its country of origin, under the strict standards of organic farming; therefore we can guarantee offering authenticity and balance of our essential oils, avoiding any external disruption.

We use up to 17 different organic botanicals in our unique INDI & Co. Handcrafted Organic Drinks: Cinchona bark, orange peel, lemon peel, tangerine peel, lime peel, cardamom, kalinji, yuzu peel, orange blossom, violet, strawberry, ginger, vanilla, cinnamon, clove, turmeric and cane sugar.

Maceration

The soluble components of botanicals are macerated in a mixture of alcohol and water over a period of 3-6 weeks.

Distillation

Distillation takes place in 200 year old ancient copper stills. The essential oils of each botanical are extracted and concentrated.

Blending

The essential oils are blended with natural juices, cane sugar and purified water.

The maceration, distillation and blending processes are carried out following strict artisanal procedures, certified by organic production standards.

We Take Care of the Environment

Our botanicals are obtained respecting the environment, saving natural resources (water and energy) and avoiding soil and water pollution. This activity generates additional laborÂ and contributes to the support of small rural communities.

LOCAL AGRICULTURE

We support small farm crops in their places of origin.

THE QUALITY

Organic farming allows botanicals to grow at their own natural pace, translating to higher quality and natural expression of their attributes.

On our journey to develop our range of INDI & Co. Mixers, our research has taken us centuries back to when the preservation and distillation traditions began in El Puerto de Santa MarÃ­a, the Guadalquivir Valley, in Andalusia, Spain.

Indi & Co organic beverages are responsible beverages, not the artificial flavors and high sugar content typically used in traditional soft drinks.

column3:
Based in Milwaukee, Wisconsin, foundersÂ Mary Pellettieri and Noah Swanson set out to start a company that changed the way people think about - and enjoy - drink mixers.

In 2014, while researching different ways to bitter beer, Mary became intrigued by the complex variety of herbs used in EuropeanÂ amari, vermouth, and bitter wines. Eventually she stumbled upon the origin of soft drinks, leading her on a path to tonic, historically described as a "bitter botanical drink" made by pharmacists and meant to provide increasedÂ health and vigor to their imbibers.

Mary and Noah began to experiment with herbs and syrups,Â pouring through old recipes for inspiration in their self-constructed commercial kitchen. Together theyÂ formulated a unique Bitter Orange Syrup that was full of warm spice and bitter orangeÂ zest and soldÂ it at local farmer's markets in Wisconsin. The response was so positive that they decided to bring their products to a broader audience.

In 2017 Top Note was born. Mary and NoahÂ launched with their aromatic Indian Tonic Water and Bitter Lemon Tonic Water, plus a unique non-alcoholic Ginger Beer formulated with date sugar. Within two weeks,Â Top Note received word that they'd won a SoFi award from the Specialty Food Association for their Indian Tonic Water. The equivalent of an Oscar for the food & beverage industry, the award put a stamp of approval on Top Note as America's new craft mixer of choice.

In 2019 they added an all-quinine Classic Tonic as well as a Sparkling Grapefruit Soda. In 2020 Club Soda No. 1 joined the lineup and quickly earned the title of "Best Club Soda outside of Japan"Â byÂ leading Japanese whisky makers.

Today, Top Note continues toÂ look forward to adding to the world of mixers with more innovative and high-quality products.Â With theirÂ craft brewer's mentality, Mary and NoahÂ put a twist on tradition for mixers set to wow the world.

Top Note Products

Top Note full line up of mixers includes their award winning Indian Tonic Water,Â  theÂ New York Times Mentioned Gentiana Soda, and their bestÂ selling Grapefruit Soda.Â 

Try a party pack for a good selection of items to keep pantry stocked, or the new NA cocktail gift set. They also have juice nectars from Tuscany to add to your order and be spring cocktail ready!

The good people at Top Note strive to ship the day you order, so you will receive your items as swiftly as feasible.Â 

Top Note makes use of a 100% paperboard package, no plastics, no peanuts. 100% recyclable, and as minimum weight as possible.Â

column3:
We could tell you that when Sarah and Emmet Condon started Remedy in their kitchen they had no idea what lay ahead. But weâ€™d be lying. They had an inkling. Theyâ€™d been making kombucha for a while. Their kids were into it. Their mates were hooked. Family members were dropping by more often for a taste.

Â 

So, they took a chance. Some might call it a massive risk. They had a young family. No jobs to fall back on. Some savings, a couple of credit cards. Entrepreneurial know-how, but no experience in the food and drinks world. What they did have was big aspirations and a simple belief. Oh and â€“ perhaps most importantly â€“ a tasty kombucha brew and a whole lotta guts.

Â 

They wanted to do something good. Shake things up. Make it right. They knew that healthy could also be tasty and easy. They believed we all deserve to know that too. While theyâ€™ve moved on from the kitchen bench, Remedy is still made the old-school way: in small batches, long-aged brewed for 30 days.

Â 

The result is the tastiest and healthiest kombucha going around: it contains no sugar, naturally, and is chock-full of all the right stuff: live cultures, organic acids and antioxidants.

column2: The Beekeepers Daughter Craft Honey Soda
column3:
Â 

The Beekeeperâ€™s Daughter started in 2010 when Hannah Burgess saw high demand for local raw honey.

After many years of watching other companies bottle our product, I decided to start our own private label. I keep all of our honey raw & unfiltered, so the honey stays just the way it was in the hive, full of pollen, aroma, flavor, and bits of wax and propolis. I started by bottling small amounts of our honey and selling it at local farmers markets. From there we have grown from selling it not only at local farmers markets, but to many stores throughout the United States and online. All of our honey is still hand bottled and delivered with pride by our family.Â 

With one sip of our craft honey soda your taste buds will buzz to life. It is simply sweetened with honey sourced from our family apiary. We hand brew our natural syrups that are infused with raw honey over a gas fired kettle. Itâ€™s then chilled and carbonated to a crisp fresh taste.

Drink these all-natural sodas chilled over ice or use them as mixers with your favorite alcoholic beverage!

Flavors:

Ginger Hibiscus Craft Honey Soda is made with real ginger, brewed with hibiscus flowers, and lightly sweetened with honey.

Â 

Lemon Basil Craft Honey Soda is made with real lemons, fresh basil, and sweetened with honey.

Â 

Swarmin' Strawberry Lemonade Craft Honey Soda with real lemons, fresh strawberries, and lightly sweetened with honey.

Â 

Lemon Mint Tea Craft Honey Soda is made with fresh brewed black tea, real lemons, fresh mint, and sweetened with honey.

Â 

Honey Bee Orange Craft Honey Soda is like sunshine in a bottle! Made with fresh squeezed Florida oranges and lightly sweetened with honey.

OUR HISTORY

Beekeeping has been a part of our family since the 1800â€™s, when our family were hobbyist beekeepers. Our honey business was established in the early 1950â€™s in Dallas, Pa by my grandfather William Perry Sr. As the years went past, more and more hives were being kept due to the demand for American honey and we have eventually buzzed our way to thousands of hives. What started out as a small business venture, has grown to become our family life.

The Organic Drink Co is a sustainable, ethical beverage company based in Byron BayÂ a beautiful coastal town in the southeastern Australian state of New South Wales.

Founded in 2015, The Organic Drink Co set out to do things differently. Committed to creating ethical, great tasting, refreshing beverages, made the old fashioned way, by hand, with no added chemicals, preservatives or additives.Â 

Low in sugar, these bottles of liquid goodness are brewed naturally using the best ethically sourced, quality organic ingredients,Â no artificialÂ flavors or syrups. Available in signature flavors Organic Ginger Beer, Organic Lemon Lime, and Organic Cola.Â 

We promise you'll taste the difference.

Committed to doing things differently, The Organic Drink Co are proud to partner withÂ 1% for the PlanetÂ andÂ CO2nsensus.Â 

Our sustainability commitment

We believe that we have a responsibility do things better. Never have we been more aware and educated on the environmental impacts on our world and the choices that are available to us. We are fortunate to have these choices and we believe in the power of the consumer to make better choices. We've consciously chosen to work with suppliers who share our beliefs and values and we continue to strive to make more sustainable choices.Â 

When it comes to the soft drink industry the largest resource and environmental concerns surround:

- waterÂ / wastewater management

- supply chain / sourcing of ingredients

- energy consumption

Our commitment to theÂ environment

- we use only biodegradable cups and recyclable bottles

- we minimizeÂ waste and recycle throughout the lifecycle of the product

- we utilizeÂ a wastewater treatment process in our brewery

- 90% of our daily energy needs are met through the use of solar power

- we aim to use only energy efficient equipment throughout the brewing process

- wherever possible we reduce our energy consumptions and where not possible we work withÂ CO2nsensusÂ to offset our carbon emissions

Our commitment to the people

we strive to improve health by:

- using organic produce - all of our ingredients are sourced locally, with flavors being derived from organic natural ingredients i.e. real lemon, limes & ginger

- adding no artificial additives or preservatives to our products

- keeping our products low in sugar without compromising on taste

Our commitment to the animals

-Â all processes and ingredientsÂ used in the creation of our products are 100% vegan

Most of all, we are committed to constantly reviewing and adapting our sustainability practices to better serve the earth and all its inhabitants.

Welcome to Moss Beach Kombucha!

Moss Beach Kombucha began with a culinary degree and a dream. Founder Douglas Nelson has always enjoyed entertaining friends and family with good food and drink.

Hospitality is a large part of his life mission. Concocting great tasting kombucha from scratch started as a hobby. "Some of our house guests seemed to enjoy my homemade brew," Nelson said. "So I started tinkering in the lab and came up with some amazing flavors."

After graduating from culinary college in San Francisco (CCSF â€˜16), Douglas took a leap of faith and launched MBK in 2017.

Good taste was what he was going for in the homebrew, years ago. Good taste is what you find in a bottle of MBK, today.

True Organic IngredientsÂ 

Moss Beach Kombucha uses real California Meyer lemons, juice from ginger, tisanes from hibiscus, celery, and lavender, and a tincture of cayenne made from Half Moon Bay Distilleryâ€™s Purissima vodka. Everything we use is organic and we are as local as we can be.

MBK Mission

Our mission is to inspire people to greater possibilities.
(We also want you to buy our tasty beverages.)

Why Drink Moss Beach Kombucha?

Made with organic, all natural ingredients with no artificial extracts, flavorings or additives. Non-GMO and Organic-certified.

Rich in antioxidants and healthy acids (including acetic, gluconic, glucuronic and aminos). Full of vitamins and minerals. Aids in digestion, liver function and promotes a healthy immune system.

Flavors

Celery Lavender:

Filtered Water, Organic Sugar, Organic Black Tea, Organic Green Tea, Organic Lavender, Organic Celery Seed.

Hibiscus Lime:

Filtered Water, Organic Sugar, Organic Black Tea, Organic Green Tea, Organic Hibiscus, Organic Lime Essential Oil.

Calyx Drinks may be made in Lancashire UK but they have not forgotten their roots.Â Calyx was bornÂ on the streets of Nigeria, where drinking hibiscus brewed with fruit and spices is the nationâ€™s daily ritual. Which is why youâ€™ll find organic flowers, fruit and spices in every one of their craft-brewed drinks.

The organic flowers, fruits and spices in the drinks are given time to mature in their natural surroundings before being used in a gentle craft-brewing process to extract all the goodness. The result is as close to nature as you can get in a bottle.

Life is full of compromises. Why should your wellbeing be one of them? Calyx drinks prepare you for whatever comes your way.

column3:
Somersault is the brainchild of three Melbourne lads and we came together because of our beliefs for a healthier lifestyle for our families. We wanted to reduce the level of sugar in our diet without being fanatical and substituting it for weird sweeteners. You would never bake a cake at home with stevia (liquorice flavor no thanks), or the industrial sweeteners xylitol or erythritol. When looking for a zero artificially sweetened Soda with 50% less sugar they didnâ€™t exist, so Somersault Soda was born and when you try it your taste buds will be thankful.Â 
Â 
Our sodas are one of a kind and people often ask how we manage to reduce the sugar by 50% without sweeteners. Well we had to get back to nature and develop techniques our ancestors have been using for 1000â€™s of years to brew the organic sugar content down and enhance the natural fruit flavors. Isnâ€™t Mother Nature a beautiful thing!
Â 
After we slow brew our Sodas for several days we add fresh organic juices & organic ingredients. Â Choosing playful combinations of flavors helps to keep the refreshment interesting.Â  Our Sodas are packed in brown bottles because reducing sunlight helps naturally preserves the Sodas and keeps the fresh flavors in. Â Just a simple way of keeping the deliciousness in the bottle without adding preservative 202 (whatever that is).

Why choose our craft Sodas

  • Somersault are natural Sodas without the sweeteners that have names you canâ€™t pronounce!
  • They are tastier because we brew the Soda to get the flavors at their peak.
  • We have crafted interesting and unique flavors that pack more than one punch.

What is a craft brewed Soda?

Step 1Â Â Â  Only the best ingredients

  • Organic sugar
  • Crushed organic fruit juice
  • Yeast to naturally lower sugar contentÂ 

Step 2Â Â Â Â  Slow brew the sodas for several days
Â 
Step 3Â Â Â Â  This part is up to you - enjoy!

Grab a bottle from one of our fab stockists. Give it a gentle roll to mix the fruit flavors, thenÂ enjoy!

Please note our products containÂ glutenÂ (a small amount of maltedÂ barleyÂ from the brewing process)

Rich in color, refreshing, and low in sugar! Aqua Monaco soda pops come in seven different varieties, from classic to quirky. Fancy Rhubarb & Ginger, or are you willing to give Matcha Energy a try? Either way, there can never be enough variety for us! These colorful bottles also look great lined up behind the bar or peeking out of the open fridge. Our organic ingredients bring out their distinct flavors nice and clear, because they are not drowned out by sugar: 100 milliliters contain less than 5 grams of sugar! So there is really no need for a guilty conscience when grabbing one of our refreshing soda pops. Our soda pops are fully organic and climate-neutral and contain no artificial sweeteners, flavors, colorants, or preservatives. We use high-quality organic juices and go entirely without citric acid. Like all Aqua Monaco products, our soda pops are climate-neutral, and you will support ourÂ Good MonacoÂ social initiative with every bottle you buy.

column3:
At The Peopleâ€™s Craft House we are committed to quality using whole natural ingredients to bring back traditional soda making for todayâ€™s soda drinkers

Independent Craft Soda is a growing industry. Connoisseurs seek out small-batch soda to try all the different creations of soft drink brew-masters.

After spending most of their lives drinking large-scale commercial sodas, most people had never experienced the authentic taste of what those beverages were like before they became cheap, mass-produced and artificially flavoured. Using recipes inspired by those original soda and tonic makers of the 1800s, we bring back the art of traditional soda making in our time.

What makes us tasteÂ soÂ much better?

  • CLASSIC FLAVOURS

    Check out our modern interpretation of these classic soda recipes. You have known them for years but youâ€™ve never tasted the real flavours before.

  • NATURAL INGREDIENTS

    We only use natural ingredients in our formulas. Never anything artificial or chemical â€“ just the good stuff that you can pronounce.

  • SMALL BATCH ARTISINAL APPROACH

    All of our sodas recipes are created in our fizzery with care and attention to detail. We respect the integrity of the ingredients and traditional techniques as a mark of distinction and guarantee of quality.

Whether you are enjoying them on their own or mixing them into a cocktail, these traditional recipes are full of complex layers of flavour that will change the way you look at soda pop.

Created specifically to be less sugary, our sodas are sweetened with a minimal amount of organic cane sugar and contain no high fructose corn syrup or chemical preservatives. We allow the fruit, flower, root, and herb flavors to shine through. We produce a full range of soda flavours under our label. We also work with companies and organizations to create custom branded soda products.

Â

column3:
Naturbrus is an honest, natural craft soda without any preservatives and added sugar. Real ingredients mixed to perfection. Nothing beats the authentic taste, and only real fruits and berries can give that.

Blueberry

The firstÂ flavorÂ we experimented with was blueberry. A delicateÂ flavorÂ to perfect, but we've always liked a good challenge. Combined with juice from apples and lemons it has a fantastic taste.Â 

Â 

Tropical

With pineapple and coconut, our tropical soda is just that. Fresh produce refined into liquid sunshine. Let your mind drift to a secluded island, feel the sand between your toes and the tropical heat of the sun. Once the feeling goes away, take another sip.

Â 

Rhubarb

Heavenly rhubarb squeezed into a bottle. To give this craft soda an edge we've added juice from a little French plum called Mirabelle. Mirabelle even means beautiful in French, and we get why!

Â Honest, Quality Craft Soda

Naturbrus is a line of small-scaleÂ all-natural craft soda from Berentsens Brygghus. Since 1895 we have produced soft drinks, and today, the company is owned and operated by 4th and 5th generation familyÂ members. All the craft soda from Naturbrus are made entirely without preservatives, thickening agents, un-natural additives, or added sugar. It's the real deal!

More Good was founded in late 2012 with one goal in mind â€“ to make this world a better place. We use locally sourced and organic ingredients to create hand-crafted soda syrup concentrates, tea and tisane concentrates, and bitters. Our mission is simple: global impact through local success.

Our vision of success is a little different than most companies. We donâ€™t define success through our ability to operate a profitable bottom line, thatâ€™s a given. Instead, weâ€™ve challenged ourselves with the task of operating a profitable bottom line while at the same time maintaining a high level of social responsibility. President and Founder of More Good, Jason Schuler, believes that it is a privilege to be a business owner â€“ and itâ€™s one that he doesnâ€™t take lightly. Everyone at More Good is committed to using our influence and successes to make this world a better place. And we invite you to do the same.

More Good hasÂ partnered withÂ Generosity.orgÂ in an effortÂ to makeÂ clean water accessible to everyone on the planet. We've pledged a minimum of $4,000 per year through two annual fundraisers; this ensures that More Good will fund at least one fully sustainable water well each and every yearÂ in parts of the world that desperately need them. In 2013 we donated over $6,800 and in 2014 we donated over $14,000!

column3:
Our story is one of experimentation and surprise. It begins with a love for tea, a hot summer day, and a challenge to create an all-new kind of tea treat.

With 11 years of tea blending experience under its belt, The Jasmine Pearl Tea Company was blossoming. Its tea-loving employees were being made into tea experts â€“ committed to excellence, but also to fun and laughter.

As afternoon sun beamed through our windows, a co-worker and I were speculating about the most refreshing summer treat we could make in the shop. We had plenty of tea at our fingertips â€“ but also ice-cream: â€œWhat if we could make a TEA FLOAT?!â€ One tea blend, Dancing Dragon, had a decidedly root beer character. But without the bubbles, it fell short of expectations. Heather, co-owner of The Jasmine Pearl, pulled a soda stream out of the break room. Suddenly, Dancing Dragon floats became a delicious reality.

That was our first creation, but it didnâ€™t stop there. The whole staff started experimenting wildly with tea sodas. Some of our favorites were total surprises â€“ Lime Twist was so bright and flavorful! Some were weirder than we hoped â€“ sorry, Ginger Peach! Every trial was exciting and soon we were sharing our creations with customers.

In March 2016, we founded Pearl Soda Company. It was born of delight in the creative opportunities tea offers. Our four original flavors represent our tea experts' favorite experiments. Our hope is that you use these tea syrups to invent your own concoctions. Whether you are whipping up sparkling teas, cocktails, lattes, desserts, or something completely unimagined, we hope they bring you the same simple delight that we get from making them.

-Liz Borders,Â Co-founder, and Formulator

column3:
Soda Press Co isÂ a little company with pure ambition, we think people's palates deserve more. Our selection of handcrafted low sugar and certified organic flavours comprise of some beloved classics through to new creations that we think will tickle your fancy. Ideal for SodaStream, cocktails, mixers, ice cold drinks, hot drinks, through to popsicles, slushies, and milkshakes. There's a whole lot of creativity to be had with just one bottle which makes 17 drinks.

We applied the best of modern and old-fashioned techniques. We only use premium natural and organic ingredients with organic brown rice syrup via a small batch, slow-brew process. This nifty innovation allows us to deliver bold flavours with 40-50% less sugar than your average syrup. And letâ€™s not forget, weâ€™ve removed all the ugly numbers too.

Enjoy guilt-free sodas, cocktails, slushies, and ice-pops, or even drizzled over ice-cream. Our syrups enable you to get creatively involved.Â 

We believe this beautiful planet of ours is way too small to be environmentally uncool. Â Where we can, we support sustainable farmers, our packing is made from recycled glass and recycled pulp. All aspects of our packaging is recyclable.

One Soda PressÂ can eliminate as many as 10 plastic bottles being produced. Â Around 200 billion (and growing) plastic bottles are produced a year, sadly most ends up in our naturalÂ environment. Â A staggering 400 billionÂ liters of precious water is used to make them. And let's not forget the 25 billion barrels of crude oil used in the process! Â 

By making smarter choices on how we produce and consume products we can play a small part and collectively stem the tide of pollution and global warming.Â

Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â The story of neighbors Chris and DanÂ 

Chris Onstad was a cartoonist who came to Portland to hide from his nemesis, California. Dan McLaughlin was a studio photographer who fled his native Georgia for the bohemian freedom of the Pacific Northwest. Chris hit midlife and wanted to mix things up, so he took a job as a restaurant critic. Dan retired from snapping dental equipment and tennis shoes to create The Dan Plan, where through 10,000 hours of deliberate practice he would attempt to go from non-golfer to PGA professional. They wound up living across a verdant suburban alley from one another.
At some point in the early days of his Portland residency, Chris tore a couple boards out of his alley fence so it would be easier for Dan to drift in when he smelled cooking. Theyâ€™d often wander out into the neighborhood after dinner with a couple pitching wedges and golf balls, forging impromptu links where the less-imaginative saw only front lawns and elementary schools. They talked of making movies, writing TV shows, and anything else that would keep them out of an office.
Chris fell in love with the people of the restaurant industry, whom he saw as artistic peers in their passion, their creativity, and their willingness to make less money in exchange for greater fulfillment. As a sober man with a menu always in his hand, he quickly realized that the needs of alcohol-free diners were markedly underserved, so he began the tinkering that became Portland Soda Works. He sought to create â€œthe Belgian beer of craft sodaâ€ using the whole-ingredient, high-integrity approach he had absorbed from his adoptive Pacific Northwest community.
Dan installed himself as the criticâ€™s critic, revealing a surprisingly sophisticated palate and facility for flavor development. Thanks to his time at The Dan Plan, he brought a steady stream of â€œgolf course typesâ€ to the tableâ€”many of whom would become the companyâ€™s anchor clients.
It is unrecorded, but at some point in 2012, the pair agreed to start a soda companyâ€”probably casually, in Chrisâ€™s kitchen, while one of them was focused on something else. An all-natural sarsaparilla root beer was their flagship offering, with a spicy whole-root ginger beer right behind. Reverend Nat West of Reverend Natâ€™s Hard Cider agreed to host their brewing kettles, which were themselves on loan from Steven Smith, the late and much-loved Portland teamaker who gave Chris some of his earliest flavor lessons and business advice.
The next few years saw clients from around the state calling for custom formulations, consultations, classes, kegs, and always more of their intensely flavorful root beer and ginger beer. Their big break came in 2014 when New Seasons Market began carrying their products, now sold in handsome bottles as â€œcocktail and soda syrups.â€
In 2015 they finally outgrew the commissary kitchen theyâ€™d been renting and built themselves a brewery in a hundred-year-old bakery along the train tracks in North Portland. Near-daily they meet with and are inspired by friends old and new, from the ever-fertile Portland food and beverage community. As a result, the quality of their products, as well as the breadth of their flavor library, grows steadily.

column3:
What does WestWood Organics soda do for you?

Every bottle of WestWood Organics organic sodaÂ isÂ designed to give you a healthy alternative to conventional pop and soda.

(This means no more high fructose corn syrup, artificial flavors, and colors, phosphoric acid, or BPA!)

They are full of healthy bacteria - probiotics - which line your digestive tract and support your immune system.

High in antioxidants, these fermented sodas help to detoxify the body and prevent diseases by decreasing inflammation, all while quenching your thirst and tasting great. Now that's something to drink to.

Â We Care About Quality

Water.Â Our water goes through a filtration system. After it is filtered we structure it.

Structured water is "nature's water" in the sense thatÂ it contains the high electrical charge/pH balance that our cells need to function at an optimum level. Water that is "structured" has a molecular composition that is more beneficial to our bodies and better for our overall health than "regular water". To better understand this revolutionary breakthrough click here.

This is not Kombucha.

Kombucha is a fermented green or black tea base with an addition of a bacteria culture known as a "scoby"Â that ferments anywhere from 7 to 20 days.

WestWood Organics sodas are fermented with a fruit tea base and a bacteria culture that ferments for up to 3 days. This explains our refreshing and powerful taste.

Many companies use plastic materials and metal containers whenÂ fermenting their products. When a product is fermented, it absorbs toxins and chemicals from the plastic and metal. The only way to avoid absorbing toxins is utilizingÂ glass and bamboo products. We clean all of our supplies and our fermentation environment with vinegar, which itself is a fermented product, and structured water, so that we are constantly introducing healthy bacteria and avoiding toxins altogether to the best of our ability.

We take every detail into consideration and make sure our bodies are clean before handling the product in any way. Before bottling our finished product, the bottles and caps themselves are rinsed with our structured water.

Our fermentation environmentÂ is constantly held at perfect temperatureÂ for the bacteria to do its work, and we utilize a Himalayan salt lamp which helps to absorb pollutants, mold, andÂ any other harmful, airborne toxins.

Â

Weâ€™re proud it is where we started from, and it is the seed from where the Gusto Organic tree has grown.

The recipe for Gusto Original remains unchanged to this day, blending 14 Chinese herbs with organic apple juice, Amazon guarana and cola nut from the rainforests of Africa.Â  There is no other organic energy drink quite like Gusto Original for a sustained lift that works naturally with your body.

For millennia the Guarani tribe in Brazil used guarana to stave off hunger and give them speed and agility whilst hunting, for Guarani peoples guarana has both practical and spiritual uses and is revered as an aphrodisiac, a source of stimulation and a means to prolong lifeâ€¦

column3:
The Gusto Organic Story

The Gusto Organic Drinks story starts at a party â€“ an excellent place to begin, donâ€™t you think?Â 

Scroll back to the summer of 1987 and youâ€™ll find Craig Sams, the hippy entrepreneur behind Whole Earth and Green & Blacks, concocting something special in his kitchen. Prepping for a big party at the Groucho Club, being thrown to celebrate 20 years of the Whole Earth brand, he decides to mix up something intriguing for the alcohol-free drinkers. In doing so, he invents Gusto Original Energy, but he names it Hurble Burble and circulates it among family and friends for a few years.

Craigâ€™s children, Rima and Karim, are the first to spot the drinkâ€™s potential after it becomes an instant hit with the rave crowd in the late 80s, offering clubbers a natural, legal way to keep going all night without the usual post-party comedown. They encourage their father to bottle it for the masses, and the drink appears under the new name, Gusto Original Energy, a couple of years later.

With its new moniker, Gustoâ€™s first official product becomes one of the first natural energy drinks to hit the world market, and the only one to do away with the usual synthetics in favour of premium, organic, Fairtrade ingredients.

Great Taste Award Winning Gusto Organic Real Cola is the first organic certified lower-calorie cola produced in the UK, sweetened with organic Fairtrade Blue Agave and organic certified Erythritol. Gusto Organic Real Cola blends organic spices, essential oils, and African Kola Nut with Devon spring water.

Real Organic Cola

Real organic cola nut and not synthetic caffeine
Our Real and Slim colas use the finest cola nut from the rainforests of Africa â€“ cola nut balances the flavour of our cola adding a bitter note to counterbalance the sweetness of agave. Cola Nut also mildly stimulates and revives in a completely natural way. Big brand colas use synthetic caffeine derived from ammonia, Gusto Cola uses the revered cola nut with its natural active ingredient â€˜Theobromineâ€™ which translates as â€˜Food of the Godsâ€™

Fairtrade Organic Cola


Fairtrade Organic Blue Agave and Fairtrade Madagascan vanilla extract
We donâ€™t use refined sugar in our drinks, we sweeten with the finest Fairtrade blue agave from Jalisco in Mexico. Blue agave tastes a little sweeter than sugar so we can use less agave which helps reduce the calories in our drinks. Our Fairtrade agave project pays local farmers more than twice the local agricultural and supports communities, promotes workersâ€™ rights, gender equality, and respect for indigenous peoples. Every bottle of Gusto Cola sold improves the lives of farmers and their communities, our ingredients come from organic farms that respect the land for future generations.

No Phosphoric Acid

Gusto Real and Slim Cola are free from phosphoric acid (commonly used as an industrial rust remover), which provides the acid â€˜biteâ€™ in a multitude of big brand colas. Phosphoric acid is proven to contribute to bone calcium depletion, weakening bones and causing osteoporosis. We use organic lemon juice to provide our distinctive citrus bite.

Sparkling Bitters is a unique sparkling water lightly flavored with a dash of tonic bitters. With no added sweeteners, zero calories, and no artificial flavors, itâ€™s a sparkling beverage you can feel good about drinking! And its bitter character is surprisingly refreshing, has a cleansing effect on your palate and provides a host of well-documented benefits for your digestive health.

By using only the finest, all-natural ingredients including gentian root extract for a touch of bitterness, we created a lightly flavored sparkling water that provides age-old tonic benefits.

What is Bitters?

Bitters, or Amari as they are known in Italy, have been enjoyed in Europe for centuries, most notably as aperitif or digestif liqueurs. Cocktail bitters were also immensely popular in 19th and early 20th century America as a key ingredient in the perfectly crafted cocktail. Today, craft mixologists have rediscovered this indispensable ingredient that makes their imbibing creations true works of art.

Try our five delicious flavors:

  • White Peach
  • Pear Ginger
  • Meyer Lemon
  • Classic Aromatic
  • Grapefruit Mint

It's amazing what a dash will do you!

Piraqua Drinks was founded in 2015 by Beth Shreve and Jen Cook-Chrysos. We began Piraqua Drinks after finding ourselves in a similar situation time and time again: at the end of a long day we were ready for a cold drink. For various reasons, it wasnâ€™t a good time for alcohol. Sparkling water is always a popular choice, but it gets boring after a while, especially if others are drinking craft beer and cocktails. Most sodas are loaded with sugar, or useÂ artificial sweeteners that turn out to have negative effects on the body*. There are other low-sugar sodas out there but we found them a bit watery and bland. We wanted a beverage that was both healthy and sublime. We couldnâ€™t find one.

Read more here ~

Â 

Â 

Â

At Seabold Ginger Beer, we never cut corners when it comes to quality. Growing up on Bainbridge Island, Washington, and spending weekends tending to our grandmotherâ€™s farm, we gained a true respect for where food comes from.Â Subconsciously, our family traditions were guiding us toward a sustainable, local, and organic way of eating. Since then, weâ€™ve learned how food affects our bodies, the environment, and the economy, and we feel strongly about making a positive impact on the community.

While traveling throughout India and Southeast Asia in 2010, we both developed an affinity for the distinct spices and flavors of these vast regions. The presence of ginger as a central ingredient in the South Asian diet sparked our interest; its piquant taste, versatility, and nutritional potency were more apparent to us than ever before. We returned home inspired by our experience and set out to find a beverage that showcased the complexity of ginger.

Months of research led us to our answer in the form of an old-fashioned British recipe: ginger beer. As our appreciation forÂ this classic beverage grew, we searched around grocery stores and farmersâ€™ markets for the perfect taste. Frankly, we couldnâ€™t find it. So we set out to make it. Seabold Ginger Beer isÂ ourÂ interpretation of this timeless ginger beverage.

Several years and countless batches later, weâ€™ve crafted a drink thatÂ captures the flavor profile and health benefits of this marvelous root. We source only the finest organic, non-GMO ginger, lemons, cane sugar, and spices to brew our ginger beer. Down the hatch!

Ingredients

Our ingredients are 100% organic and contain no GMOâ€™s. We source the finest quality ingredients available.

Philosophy

Seabold boils down to one thing: quality. Our ingredients are hand selected and our beverage is handcrafted.

Weâ€™ve learned how food affects our bodies, the environment, and the economy, and we feel strongly about making a positive impact on the community.

Pat & Jon Mathisen ~

column3:
About Kombucha Dog

While we stand by our goal of finding homes for rescue dogs through delivering a delicious, naturally fermented beverage; we are gung ho on educating consumers about How much Kombucha is really in your kombucha. Â 

To the world, Kombucha stands for fermented tea w/

  • Low levels of sugar

  • Low in Alcohol

  • High in Beneficial organic acids

  • All the amazing benefits of natural fermentation

  • None of our ingredients come from a laboratoryÂ 

  • Made by nature, not by science.

And with all of that comes around 1.2% alcohol. Thereâ€™s no way around it.
Â 

Raw and Organic

The ingredients used in our kombucha are hand-selected. We only use the very best organic tea, raw turbinado sugar, and cold-pressed juices. The final product is what we believe to the very best tasting, purest, most healthful kombucha on the market. Not to mention it is a gluten-free, vegan, raw, never pasteurized, BPA-free, non-GMO, organic experience.

Undiluted = Healthy & Pure

In order to make kombucha below the legal limit of 0.5% ABV, many companies dilute their kombucha by 60-70%. At this point, you canâ€™t really call it kombucha, and it no longer has the potent health benefits of â€œauthentic kombucha.â€ Donâ€™t worry, we would never dilute our kombucha. When you drink Kombucha Dog, you can be sure that you are getting 100% of the probiotics and healthful acids that you deserve with no filler.

Our DogsÂ 

All of the dogs featured on our labels are rescue dogs in foster homes and awaiting adoption by a new loving family.Â

column2: Love Kombucha ~ Drink Healthy, Feel Healthy
column3:
Love Kombucha was founded by Melanie in 2013. A fizzy drink addict who suffered terribly with IBS, she read about kombucha and wanted to try some. However, whilst there were hundreds of brands online, she couldnâ€™t readily find any that were in the UK so decided to make her own. The natural effervescence of kombucha helped her kick the fizzy drink habit and her IBS all but disappeared. She began sharing her homemade kombucha with friends and family and things soon got a little out of hand. Now she is the proud owner of a
microbrewery than can brew 10,000 litres of kombucha every month and she even had to get a forklift truck to help cope with the demand for larger orders.

Whilst things have stepped up a notch (or two) rest assured the brewing processes are just the same, everything is still brewed by hand and our kombucha remains organic, unpasteurized and low in sugar â€“ just how it should be.Â 

Whilst kombucha may be relatively new to you, it has, in fact been around for more than 2000 years and probably closer to 5000. There are many stories that claim to explain the heritage of kombucha, some of which are confused and others downright unlikely.

Read more here ~

DRINK CARBONISTA ANDÂ Support TheÂ Cause

Clean, drinkable water is something we often take for granted. We simply turn on the tap, and clean water comes out. But we do not know that 663 million people do not have the basic access to clean water. In Africa alone, people spend 40 billion hours every year walking for water. Imagine that you are carrying 80 pounds of water in yellow fuel cans, digging in sand for water, and lining up at a well for hours for a turn.

Charity: Water has funded more than 16,000 clean water projects benefited more than 5 million people in 24 countries around the world since its inception in 2006. All the donations will go to building clean water projects, such as freshwater wells, rainwater catchments and sand filters.

While we enjoy making our sparkling drinks, we never forget those who are still struggling everyday just to quench their thirst. We promise to give away 10% of our profits every month to create more clean water. Your purchase can help end the water crisis and change people's lives.

column3:
Who said cola needs to be syrupy sweet?

The kola nut tastes bitter. The original recipe for the original Coca Cola was designed to mask its drugs and alcohol, so we now think of "cola flavor" as a combination of tang, spicy, sweet, and savory. However the balance in today's factory colas is all syrupy sweet, and hardly any spice. Which is to say, there really is no balance at all.

So we started over. And unlike other colas, Q Kola is made with a "k" and:

  • Organic ingredients from real trees and plants: kola nut, cinnamon, cloves, coriander, lemon, lime, orange, and nutmeg
  • A dash of organic agave, not loads of high fructose corn syrup or sugar
  • Only 70 calories
  • A beautiful glass bottle, which preserves taste and carbonation

We set out to make the world's best tasting sodas. We use real ingredients and carefully select them based on taste alone, regardless of cost or technical challenge. This makes Q Kola a truly superior cola - clean, crisp, and not too sugary with a nice balance of spice, tang, savory, and sweet. Enjoy!

column3:
The Iconic French Taste

In 1895, Victor Geyer installs his minuscule shop in a small French village called Munster, the singular laboratory where he hopes to concoct a magic potion from ancestral formulas long kept secret by a handful of families in Lorraine, and capable of quashing even the most rebellious thirst.

Like the medieval alchemists who dreamed of transforming the metals into gold, Victor experiments with thousands of mixtures. This period of trial and error goes on for months and months, but in the end, Victor succeeds in creating his magical lemonade.

And for the rest of his life, he would keep a small notebook tucked away in his pocket where he carefully inscribes ingenious recipes for new brews with berries, oranges, and mandarins that his sons would later use to add to their collection of popular beverages.

Three generations of â€œMaitres Limonadiersâ€ have passed on their â€œsavoir-faire,â€ producing a uniquely French Artisanal Soda.

Lorina is carefully crafted using the time-honored secret family recipe.
The All-Natural Artisanal Sodas are bottled daily, using only the best ingredients and natural fruit flavors selected from the best origins.

Â
