column3:
Almost a century ago Bavarian biermeisters developed our unique formula as an alternative to beer. They blended Sicilian apple with natural herbs and spices calling it â€œFassbrauseâ€ â€“ the soft drink with a head. This remarkable beverage was prepared and delivered much like beer, in wooden barrels, sitting on the back of a horse-drawn wagon.

In the early 1960s, we brought the drink to the Rocky Mountain. We honored its origins by calling it â€œApple Beerâ€ identifying it with other traditional sodas such as root beer and ginger beer.

Apple Beer branding has evolved over the years but we have maintained our commitment to great flavor and high-quality ingredients.

Apple Beer has remained a family-owned company for over four decades.

Since 2006 Apple Beer in bottles has been all-natural and made with pure cane sugar.

In 2012, we introduced Apple Beer FIVE, our delicious 5-calorie drink made with Acai Berry and Ginseng.Â

RHUBARB & THAI BASIL SODA

We love Rhubarb.Â  RhubarbÂ is objectively greatÂ and weÂ naturally wanted to turn it into an all natural soda. So we travelled east in search of a companion, or indeed really really west, finding one in Thai Basil (more of a metaphorical journey to be honest, we never really left Edinburgh, we did however go to Waitrose more than a few times).

Our Rhubarb and Thai Basil Soda was the very first recipe we developed and is one that we are really proud of. Itâ€™s a beacon of natural soda simplicity, containing just Rhubarb, Thai Basil, Water and Sugar.

CUCUMBER & FENNEL SEED SODA

A 1998 study in Chicago found that out of a range of scents, women found the combination of cucumber and anise the most arousing, a study we 100% promise was not the inspiration for this soda. Â Instead, we sought to create a light and refreshing soda filled with wonderful things. Â We couldnâ€™t look too much further than Cucumber, adding Fennel Seeds to bring depth.

But, like the late nineties rave scene, sodas need acid, and traditionalÂ sources of acidity, your lemons and limes of this world, overpowered the delicate cucumber flavour. Â So we looked to the world of cocktails for inspiration (a real tough phase in our recipe development) finding what we needed in the world of shrubs. Â This soda contains Cucumber, Fennel Seed, White Wine Vinegar, Water and Sugar.

Drinkwell SoftersÂ are an organic, fresh-brewed and naturally effervescent beverage made with herbs from our farm like lavender, lemon verbena or rose geranium.

Mixing whey, organic sugar and distilled herbs, or hydrosols, and then letting them ferment together, we make a truly fantastic, naturally carbonated drink you won't soon forget. Welcome to Luscombe, where we've been making beautiful drinks since 1975. Based on a farm in deepest Devon, all of our drinks are crafted with exceptional care and integrity. Gabriel David, the head of our family-owned business, sources the ingredients direct from growers he trusts. There are no compromises, only the best goes into the bottle.

We go to very great lengths to make drinks that will be a real pleasure to taste. From the time, we take talking to growers and suppliers to the fine details of recipes and the almost neurotic attention to details, including all the bespoke pieces of equipment made for us by craftsmen. We really try to make it as it should be made - no shorthand, tricks or shortcuts, just a genuine drink with as few steps in the process as possible.

Some people say we are obsessed - we think that's a compliment.

WHAT IS YUZU?

Yuzu is a small, yellow citrus that carries hints of lime, grapefruit and mandarin with floral undertones.
It has three times the Vitamin C of an orange and an abundance of flavonoids that acts as powerful antioxidants.
Yuzu has been highly regarded in the Far East forÂ its medicinal properties for over 1,200 years.
The best quality Yuzu grows in small batches on the coasts of Korea & Japan.
Our Yuzu fruit drinks come in still and sparkling variations.
We use the highest grade raw Yuzu juice and Yuzu oils in our products. Our Yuzu is sourced from a single appellation. Our drinks do not contain any flavourings,Â artificial sweeteners or preservatives.

Chinotto

The connoisseurs' drink with the retro flavor, made with natural extract of bitter orange

Chinotto is a soft drink, made with a natural extract from bitter oranges (Citrus myrtifolia), and other natural flavours. An Italian dark soft drink, which looks a little like Cola, Chinotto has a more bitter flavour, though it also has a particularly fresh aftertaste. This drink is made to the traditional Polara recipe, using the natural extract from an ancient oriental citrus, the Polara Chinotto Ancient Recipe releases a full-bodied, pleasingly sour tart flavour.Serve at any time of day, at any time during the meal, the chinotto of yesterday is back on the market as the beverage of gourmets, one of the most popular drinks for connoisseurs of Made in Sicily.Â

Bundaberg Brewed Drinks is a proud family owned business, based in the small Australian town that shares our name, Bundaberg. Our family, the Flemings, founded the brewery and still run it to this day. For as long as weâ€™ve been in business weâ€™ve lived by one simple rule; If itâ€™s worth brewing itâ€™s worth brewing well.

Most drinks on the market are quick, factory mixes that take less than one hour to make. We carefully craft-brew our drinks for as long as it takes to achieve an exceptional taste. If that means taking seven days, weâ€™ll take seven days.

Ever been wooed by a fancy bottle only to find the drink inside is a bit average? Nothing compares to the natural taste that comes from real fruit juices, herbs and spices. Some drinks fake it. Bundaburg makes it, for real.

The fertile sub-tropical soils of Queensland on Australiaâ€™s east-coast are perfect for growing ginger and sugarcane. So whenever we can, we proudly source local product. We even grow some of our own.

We believe thereâ€™s a simple art to taste-testing a natural product like ours; Get real people to do it. Slight variations in temperatures and crops can subtly influence a brew and we certainly donâ€™t leave it up to computers to decide whatâ€™s right.

ONE OF A KIND SMALL BATCH BEVERAGES

Crafted and carbonated in Charleston, SC, Cannonborough sodas are a playful combination of fresh pressed juices, hand picked herbs and fruits at the peak of ripeness. With help from farmers across the Lowcountry, our flavors are constantly evolving within the window of seasonality. For each soda, a single fruit is selected, juiced, and paired with various aromatics to add complexity. Natural sweeteners such as cane sugar, honey, or agave nectar are then delicately added to achieve a crisp balance of sweetness and acidity. Free from artificial preservatives, the mixture is force carbonated, and bottled in small batches. The result is a unique sparkling beverage as interesting as it is refreshing.

Bottlegreen all natural soft drinks was founded in 1989 by Kit and Shireen Morris. Today, Bottlegreen celebrates over 30 successful years in the soft drinks market.

Inspired by their background in wine making and a desire to create something out of the ordinary, Kit and Shireen began experimenting with an abundance of local elderflowers growing right on their doorstep. Using a unique cold filtration process, traditionally used for wine making, their hand picked elderflower cordial was created and the rest was history! The Bottlegreen mill is still based in the heart of the CotwoldsÂ a region in central-southwest England, where it all began and where they draw spring water from their very own spring.Â 

Kit and Shireen have always believed in creating the finest natural soft drinks possible and theyÂ invite you to experience these delicate, subtle flavors for yourself in their award-winning and beautifully crafted drinks range.

column3:
Â 

Â 

All are gently carbonated, all are totally free from additives or preservatives, and all are made with grape or apple juices, instead of sugar, giving a light sweetness and depth of flavour most unusual in a soft drink.

Our ingredients are grown for us, like the elderflowers from our philosophers farm in Surrey, or sourced specially by us, like the ripe Brazilian Oranges we use in our Zesty orange (no added sweetness, there, it all comes from the oranges and the Brazilian sunshine).

Our recipes stand the test of time and fashion, like our unique Cranberry and Hibiscus, blending the tart cranberry with the softer fruitiness of dried hibiscus flowers. And try our Orchard Cola....a unique take on you know what, made from botanical ingredients mixed with fruit juice and herbs, delicious and refreshing.

At Zeo, we make a range of lightly carbonated soft drinks. Inside each bottle is 98% spring water blended with naturally extracted fruits and botanicals.Â 

All Natural Ingredients

Our exciting crisp tastes are created by blending 32 fruits and botanicals gathered from around the world with cold, clear, refreshing, mineral-rich spring water from the heart of England. Even our deliciously bright shimmering colours are extracted from nature.

Sweetness from Nature

Weâ€™d never sweeten anything for the sake of it. But the truth is that you need a little sweetness to create a great taste. We source most of the sweetness from natural Stevia plants from South America, which are 400 times sweeter than sugar, but have 0 calories. The rest of the sweetness comes from a touch of sugar beets and natural sugar cane.

Crafted in small batches

It took five years of skilful work by our flavour experts to refine Zeo. Our flavours are crafted in small batches; distilled and blended to make each recipe from its naturally sourced ingredients.

Zeo gives you a crisp and refreshing taste experience.

Discover YogaSoda

YogaSoda is a Toronto based Kombucha tea company. Kombucha is a fermented tea that has been consumed around the world for thousands of years for its incredible health benefits. Kombucha is made by fermenting a sweetened tea with a SCOBY (Symbiotic Colony of Bacteria and Yeast). This living colony breaks down the sugars, leaving a deliciously refreshing, lightly carbonated tea for everyone to enjoy.Â 
We make our YogaSoda Kombucha with both herbal and caffeinated organic fair-trade teas and we sweeten it for you with only raw organic cane sugar.
The time has come for a conscious soda. Cheers to your health!

Founded in early 2003 by Steve Hersh and Jeannette Luoh, GuS was what the founders and their friends were looking for in a beverage; something not so sweet like everything else out there. But not so dull and lifeless like flavored seltzers and waters. Or artificial, like diet drinks.

Steve grew up in a household where his father added seltzer to everything. This was done to cut the sweetness, and make juice and soda lighter and more refreshing. It also reduced the calories, but that wasn't really the point.

Now that tradition continues with GuS sodas. They're distinctive sodas made with real juice and real flavor extracts, in refreshing flavor varieties. They're pasteurized and kosher, with no caffeine. And they're lightly sweetened with cane sugar, with only 90 - 98 calories in each 12oz. bottle.

column3:
The worldâ€™s first flawless soft drink

The Koji mission was long and difficult but we finally achieved our goal to create a healthy, unadulterated and absolutely â€˜nasty- freeâ€™ soft drink, without compromising on quality or taste.

We believe sweeteners are the root of all evil so the start of our journey was to eliminate all artificial sweeteners â€“ we refused to use stevia, aspartame or any other enhancer or additive. We didnâ€™t want to add too much sugar either as sugary drinks can be sticky and high in calories.

We wanted a clean, crisp and refreshing soft drink, low in calories and great with food or simply having fun with friends â€“ a non-alcoholic choice that we actually wanted to drink. But when you leave out sweeteners and flavour enhancers, the result can often be unpalatable!Â 

Deep in the heart of Japanese tradition, we found a natural process that would bring our dream to life â€“ Koji â€“ it is the way to make soy sauce and Sake as well as other foods. Koji is an age old method that extracts flavour from ingredients, removing sugars but keeping the flavour. Inspired by this traditional process, we developed our own patented technique, enabling us to retain all the flavour and nutritional properties of our ingredients.

A complex blend of dried fruit, spices and herbs with a wide range of nutritional and health benefits makes our base fruit infusion. The heart of Kojiâ€™s flavour comes from Japanese Persimmon, goji berries, lemon peel, challenger hops and apple.

By overlaying natural flavour highlights with unique aromas like Elderflower, Lime and Mandarin and adding some gentle bubbles we are left with a wonderfully pure and exceptionally low calorie drink. All natural, no short cuts, great tasting.

KOJI â€“ enlightened refreshment.

Fruit Sodas

The Capi brand was born from a simple idea to produce clean, natural
carbonated refreshments in a world full of mass production, Capi wanted
to defy the norm through its craftsmanship, quality ingredients and
outstanding drinks..

Taking on the sourcing and blending responsibilities ourselves, we have
secured the finest natural extracts and botanicals, working with
latitude, climates, seasonality and exotic locations.Our commitment
extends to our blending and manufacturing practices where we don't
use preservatives.By keeping our mixers pure and clean you have the
ability to taste the true profile of the spirit and ultimately can
enjoy a better finished drink..
Free of Sodium Benzoate, Potassium Sorbate, Sunset Yellow, Saccharin, Acesulfame, Phenylalanine, Aspartame, Allura Red.

About Us

At Lovely Drinks we are inspired by the bounty of Englandâ€™s orchards and hedgerows.Â 

Based in the North Somerset countryside near Bristol, Lovely Drinks began as a hobby in our garden shed using elderflowers from nearby fields.Â It is now an award-winning and thriving (but still small) family business. We still blend, process and pack the bottled drinks ourselves in a converted sawmill five minutes' walk from our home.

Our Mission

Our mission at Lovely Drinks is to produce a delicious range of soft drinks using the highest quality ingredients we can find, sourced locally or within the UK wherever possible.

Our Drinks

At Lovely Drinks we produce an award-winning range of quintessentially English sparkling soft drinks and juices. They are made by hand with carefully sourced ingredients and since 2009 11 of our flavours have won Great Taste awards. This year we won our category in the Bristol Good Food Awards and nn 2014 and 2013 we won the Bath Good Food award for our category. We've also been shortlisted for the BBC Food & Farming Awards.

WOULDNâ€™T IT BE NICE

Our beverages are all natural fizzy drinks comprising of; carbonated water, freshly squeezed whole fruit juice, raw cane sugar with infused flavour from herbs, spices, and petals.

We donâ€™t use artificial sweeteners. We use raw cane sugar. Real fruit juice also has natural sugar fructose. Sugar is still sugar, and both fructose and sugar are *not cool* for us.

Despite this we started Roots Soda Co. because we still wanted a soda ourselves every once in a while, on a nice day, with a nice meal, or just down the pub and on the wagon.

But we wanted an alternative choice. One that was 100% all natural with nothing artificial added. One that tasted like real fruit. One with clear labels. We wanted a real alternative we could trust.

Our labels clearly and simply list all our ingredients. There is nothing in the soda that is not on the label.

Our sodas contain no artificial sweeteners, colourings, flavourings, preservatives or caffeine.

Â 

Â

Â 

There is nothing better at quenching thirst like a chilled soda but they are getting a bad rap for being filled with artificial colours, flavours and lots of sugar. We love sodas but not anything artificial. That is why we have crafted a line of all genuine sparkling sodas that are simply made from real fruit juices, spices and herbs.

At The Tapping Tapir, we believe in the simplicity of all natural ingredients but celebrate the complexity of flavours that go into making our sparkling sodas

The Tapping Tapir, like one of Malaysiaâ€™s most iconic animals, the tapir is distinctly malaysian. Our sodas are homegrown in malaysia utilising local iconic ingredients.

Who We Are
Emma & Tomâ€™s is a proudly Australian owned business that was founded in 2004 by childhood friends Emma Welsh and Tom Griffith.

Emma & Tomâ€™s brand philosophy, Look After Yourself, runs throughout the business, as we are committed to helping ourselves and all Australians to look after themselves by offering nutritious minimally processed whole fruit products that are good for youâ€¦ and taste great too!

What We Do
We have built our business by working closely with our producers, offering our clients great service and delivering a product to our customers that we are very proud of. The Emma & Tomâ€™s range includes fresh whole fruit smoothies, life bars packed with fruit, seeds and nuts, refreshing quenchers and our lightly sparkling fruit juice.

What Makes Us Different
Emma & Tomâ€™s whole fruit smoothies use whole fruits so all of the fleshy goodness goes into the bottle. Each bottle of Emma & Tomâ€™s provides about 15% of your daily fibre requirement and at least 2 portions of whole fruit â€“ juice, flesh and all. Unlike many long life fruit juices on the Australian market, our whole fruit smoothies are flash pasteurised and cold filled, so the fruit flavour and goodness is retained and the juice is as close to the original fruit as is possible The juices are free from preservatives, concentrates, added sugar, artificial flavours and colours â€“ yes the juice is naturally that bright!

Each year, we donate more than $100,000 worth of juice,Â Emma & Tomâ€™s Sparkling and bars to community groups, fundraising events and charities such as the Peter MacCallum Cancer Centre, Pink Ribbon, Second Bite and the Prahran and St Kilda Missions.

Our square bottles are made from light, recyclable plastic and donâ€™t require the industrial amounts of gas that it takes to create glass bottles. They store more efficiently than round bottles and therefore each pack can be minimally wrapped in plastic. We also support Australian farmers, sourcing fruit from all over the country such as Kingston Pride mangoes from Far North Queensland, Valencia oranges and apples from the Murrumbidgee Irrigation Area and stonefruit from South Australia.

column3:
Itâ€™s the real, â€˜real thingâ€™, a cola made with Fairtrade and organic ingredients including real cola nut from the rain forests of West Africa.

Karma Cola's original recipe combines real cola nut from the Boma village in Sierra Leone with vanilla bean grown by the Forest Garden Growers Association in Sri Lanka and organically grown and processed sugar cane from the Suminter Organic Farmers Consortium in Maharashtra India.

We use organic malt extract for flavor and color instead of artificial coloring, preservatives or phosphoric acid (a cheap chemical ingredient that adds acidity to conventional cola and is good for removing rust).Â 


WHAT GOES AROUND COMES AROUND

Our cola is grown by farmers like Idrisa Bonah & Mustapha Sesay. In addition to paying farmers a fair price, All Good Organics are working directly with cola nut farmers in the Boma village in Sierra Leone, to help rebuild their crops and their communities in the aftermath of war.


With Karma Cola what goes around really does come around. Every time you drink it, part of the proceeds from each bottle sold will go back to the Boma Village in Sierra Leone.Â 

Part of the proceeds from the sale of every bottle of Karma Cola goes back to the people of Boma and Naiahun to invest in community projects. Â Funds from sales of Karma Cola have already helped to build a bridge to connect two parts of the village that couldn't be crossed easily, and are sending 45 children to school. Even more projects are planned for the coming year.


MAMI WATA
The design of the Karma Cola bottle blends African imagery with the Eastern idea of karma and the Western idea of â€˜colaâ€™. The blue and red iconic design represents the African water spirit, Mami Wata, who embodies both good and evil.Â 




Â

Ingredients: Carbonated Water, Organic Pure Cane Sugar, Non-GMO Citric Acid, Organic Natural Flavorings

Handcrafted in Seattle, WA

Rachel's ginger beer is made in Seattle using fresh water, lemons, organic sugar and ginger. we believe in this brew, and we're pretty sure that you will too.

Simple ingredients are key. Fresh lemons, strong roots, organic cane sugar and good water made intimate with one another and brewed to taste here in Seattle. Partnering with several local farms weâ€™ve befriended through Seattle farmers markets, we brew with care and attention to detail, offering our original recipe and rotating seasonal varietals such as Strawberry Rhubarb, Asian pear, Cranberry-Apricot, Blueberry, and Carrot Beet.

We believe in this brew

While living and working for several years in Europe, we were introduced to proper ginger beer. Brewed in many neighborhood pubs and served on tap, the British ginger beers we fell in love with representing a level of quality and craftsmanship we felt was absent in mass-produced American sodas. So, after returning home to the PNW, we set ourselves to the task of mastering what we believe is the best ginger beer in the world; fresh fragrant and not too sweet.

A natural, classic non-alcoholic ginger beer made with fresh pressed ginger juice.

Named "Outstanding Beverage of the Yearâ€ in 2000 by the National Association of the Specialty Food Trade (NASFT) the food and beverage equivalent of the Academy Awards. Our non-alcoholic ginger beer is made with fresh pressed Peruvian ginger juice and is all natural. No HFCS.

Ingredients

water, cane sugar, naturally pressed ginger juice, natural ginger extract, citric acid, natural flavor.

One bottle contains 148 calories, 20mg sodium, 36g carbs.

Gluten Free.
All Natural.

We have gone to the ginger beer connoisseurs and created this full bodied "just like grandpa used to make" brew. Just look at the bottom of the bottle and you will see the Organic Buderim Ginger in there. If you love ginger beer this is a must!

We only ever use the highest quality natural ingredients

At Fever Tree, it's all about taste. Which is why co-founders Charles and Tim have traveled to some of the most remote, beautiful, and sometimes dangerous, regions of the world to source the highest quality natural ingredients from small specialist suppliers.

Fresh Green Ginger

The discovery of this ginger from the Ivory Coast was a real 'eureka' moment for Charles and Tim. Unlike any other ginger, it has an incredible lemongrass freshness to its aroma due to the oils being extracted as soon as the ginger is harvested. Charles has visited the farmers in the Ivory Coast who are cultivating this unique ginger and distilling the oils specially for Fever-Tree.

By brewing a blend of three gingers from Nigeria, Cochin and the Ivory Coast we have created an award winning ginger beer that has been highly acclaimed by gastronomes and critics alike. Perfect in a Dark & Stormy, Moscow Mule or simply as a soft drink on its own.

Also available: Naturally Light Ginger Beer

Celebrate Taste

DRY is a sparkling beverage worthy of gourmet food pairing and premium mixology.

Iâ€™ve always had a passion for the culinary world and enjoy making the most out of each part of a meal â€“ the beverage included. So when I had four children, I wasnâ€™t going to let a lack of wine or cocktails stop me from creating a great pairing. Working with some of the Pacific Northwestâ€™s leading chefs, I discovered how to use unique flavor notes to create sparkling beverages that are simple and unexpectedly palate pleasing. Iâ€™m thrilled to have turned a personal passion into a product that so many other food lovers are now able to enjoy. Cheers!

Â 

SHARELLE KLAUS

FOUNDER & CEO

• Our Soda

    • Six Barrel Soda Co. grew from a love of classic sodas and soda fountain culture. We make our sodas and soda syrups in our Wellington kitchen the old fashioned way from real ingredients.

      The colors & flavors come from the natural ingredients, weâ€™re drink makers not chemists. We keep them in brown bottles because like good beer the amber glass protects them from the sun and keeps them perfect.

      Our drinks have no preservatives and all our ingredients are natural, we hand make and hand bottle everything in small batches.

      Take our drinks to a friendâ€™s for dinner, have them at your favorite cafe, mix them with liquor or give them to your kid for a treat, thatâ€™s what they are for.

    • Bottled Sodas

      Our bottled soda range is perfect for those who simply must drink our drinks without a momentâ€™s wait, for busy bars who want their mixer quality to match their liquor quality, for picnics at the beach, for an afternoon cafe meeting when youâ€™ve already had three coffees that day, for dinner parties, for the train ride to the country for the weekend, for looking pretty in a cafe fridge and for those who forgot to get gas for their sodastream.

      They come in celery tonic, sarsaparilla, raspberry & lemon, coffee, salted cucumber & Mint (sugar free) and a limited edition that is changed seasonally.

The Bibbs Story

Bibbs sparkling juice drinks were inspired one steamy August weekend on a deck overlooking Sachem Pond at the North end of Block Island. It was here that a party of friends picked fresh native blackberries. They squished and blended pitcher after pitcher of refreshing sparkling combinations until stained a deep shade of purple and laughing hysterically. The result of this revelry is our fabulous tasting all natural blackberry based sparkling juice beverages.

Bibbs all natural sparkling juice beverages are sweetened only with real fruit juices, natural and organic flavors, and evaporated cane juice. Bibbs is gluten and caffeine free, and NEVER uses refined sugar, high fructose corn syrup, preservatives or artificial coloring of any type. These refreshing beverages are a healthy thirst quenching alternative to mass marketed brands.


All natural sparkling beverages contain:

  • NO Refined Sugar
  • NO preservatives
  • NO Caffeine
  • Very LOW Sodium
  • ALL NATURAL
  • Gluten Free

If you love cola but you don't love the preservatives then this is for you.

How Did We Get Started?

Over 12 years ago Alicia Parker couldnâ€™t find any fresh organic juice for her son, Max, she enlisted her father, John, who had founded Mr. Juicy 30 years before.

With the help of dedicated Australian 100% organic farmers, who grow their fruit without using chemical fertilisers and pesticides, Parkerâ€™s Organic Juices was born.

Where We Are Now

Today, Aliciaâ€™s 3 children have grown up healthy on organic juices, and Australians have enjoyed over 5 million Parkerâ€™s Juices, and Parkerâ€™s has spread across the world as the only 100% Australian owned, 100% organic and 100% cold-pressed Juicery!

With fresh organic produce grown across Australia, parkerâ€™s state-of-the â€“art cold-pressing and juicing centre in Sydney, Australia, remains the only operation in Australia to use nothing but pure fruit and vegetables, and to prove it you can even notice slight flavor changes over the year as the seasons change and nature has itâ€™s way!

We are proud of this as it just shows you that we only use real 100% organic fruit and vegetables.

We pair herbs with de bittered citrus to create unique and sophisticated flavors that please bored palates and excite the imagination.

SIP is all about health, so we start with heavily mineralised water, add healthy herbs and balance with a titch of easily metabolised cane sugar, that boasts only 25 calories per 12 oz bottle.

SIP complements carefully prepared food, mixes well with your favorite spirits and adds to the conversation between two, ten or hundreds of people.

Discover the Rosemary Lime paired with that perfect hot meat sandwich or the Lavender Lemon Peel with your favorite Gin or Chocolate. Go spicy with the Coriander Orange and see how it pairs perfectly withÂ  Indian cuisine.

SIP transforms a mediocre dish, drink or party into something memorable.

Every SIP offers you a new taste or a new friend.. . enjoy!

Â Our Mission

To take the beverage industry in a different direction. . . away from the overly sweet, the false health claims and the just plain, boring flavors that appeal to the masses.

We care deeply about safe levels of added sugar in beverages and the importance of reducing diabetes, obesity and heart disease so we proudly exceed the standards set by WHO, Harvard Public Health and CSPI.

Our focus is on educating consumers & industry on healthy beverage options and providing disruptive leadership to create awareness and force change.

column3:
Where weâ€™ve come from

Iâ€™ve always loved soda, itâ€™s my favorite treat. Itâ€™s been a lunchtime staple of mine for decades. For a few years I even worked for the second largest soft drink manufacturer in the world.

Â But as Iâ€™ve matured, the sodas I encounter hold less and less appeal. The flavors are boring, formulas are artificial and brands are uninspiring. I believed I could make a better soda, so I did.

Â Just Craft Soda is exactly the sort of soda I want to drink, itâ€™s flavorful, natural and sophisticated. I hope you like it too.

Â John McEachern, Founder ~

Â Just Craft Soda is a delicious carbonated beverage that comes in five flavors youâ€™ve never tasted in a soft drink:

â€¢Â Â Â  Lemon & Lemongrass
â€¢Â Â Â  Peach & Habanero

Each flavor pairs a fruit with a complimentary herb or spice to create an elevated, balanced taste profile .

Just Craft Soda is made from 60% fruit juice and other simple, recognizable ingredients: water, organic cane sugar, carbon dioxide & natural flavor. Nothing artificial, just the good stuff.

We hope youâ€™ll love it as much as we do.

Â

Spruce Soda company is a beverage company based out of Minneapolis, MN. Â We are devoted to creating natural and refreshing beverages using real ingredients. Â 

For us, it all started with ginger beer. Â This botanically brewed beverage is crisp and clear; a call back to a time we so fondly remember as kids, vacationing on the north shore of Lake Superior; the cold fresh northern air accented with pine, tingling our senses. Â The simple ingredients of water, fresh ginger and lemon juice compliment each other so well that we felt inspired to share it with all of you.

Our Ginger Beer is the first of many new and exciting botanically brewed beverages to come. Â We invite you to stay tuned as we begin this beverage adventure.

No matter what, you can always count on your refreshment to be Brewed True.

How do you make root beer?

Eva Duckler: Itâ€™s really simple. You just steep out a bunch of herbs using water extraction. I donâ€™t use any extracts except for vanilla extract. Itâ€™s all extracted in-house. Then you caramelize some sugar and add some honey, and thatâ€™s what you get. And then you carbonate it in a keg. Sarsaparilla is the classic root beer flavor. But a lot of vanilla is really important. A lot of people feel strong about using anise, so thereâ€™s a little anise, but that wasnâ€™t a flavor that I always loved when I was trying them, so I got to customize it to my taste.
The flavor is really layered and balanced: a lot of herbal kick to it, but itâ€™s balanced by a rich, full sweetness and really different from mainstream root beers.
Itâ€™s crazy different. If you tried it side-by-side with other root beers, it wouldnâ€™t taste anything like them. We donâ€™t use any artificial flavors or colors or high fructose corn syrup to sweeten it. Itâ€™s like what Iâ€™d like to think root beer tasted like back at its origins in the 1800s, when people were just drinking it made from roots, or fermented and alcoholic. Itâ€™s really different from what youâ€™d expect, but it has the herbal notes you might expect from any major brand.

All natural, small-batch craft root beer.Â  Hand made at our mountain town brewery with pure can sugar, aged organic vanilla extract, and pure maple syrup.

Tommy Knockers root beer has a distinct flavor in comparison to other root beers, attributable to the unique ingredients used in its creation, including mountain cherry, mountain maple, valerian root, fenugreek, St. John's wort, melissa, birch, licorice root, hops extract, malt extract, and maple syrup.

Our Storyï»¿

In 2003, Austin set aside his artisan beer obsession and began experimenting with other craft beverages. Starting with small-batch ginger beers and fermented fruit bubblies, demand from friends and family began to outpace his hobby-level production. Austin's wife, Hallie, suggested using honey to sweeten his ginger brew. Wisely, Austin obliged as he always listens to his beauty. After perfecting their craft brewed soda recipes, Hallie and Austin decided to take the plunge and combine their love of soda with their deep respect for the local food movement and launched Wisco Pop in July of 2012! They worked along side Zacâ€™s seed-to-plate Homegrown Pizza cart for a number of events, and while we wonâ€™t say it was love at first sight...it was damn close. Zacâ€™s organizational skills and knowledge of plants and agriculture make the three a perfect match to bring craft brewed soda to Sconnie and beyond.

When sourcing ingredients for our sodas, we're thinking about one thing, Keepin' it Real. No processed corn, no artificial flavorings. Nature has all the flavor we need, fresh fruit juice, pure wisco honey, and genuine spices and herbs, for a real Wisconsin brew. Wisco Pop! makes it okay to drink soda again. So welcome back old friend, welcome to, Real, Fresh, Soda.

column3:
OUR MISSION

Our founder, Ben Goodwin, began developing Obi in 2008 with the philosophy that drives our mission today.

Health is the foundation on which higher functioning and happiness are sustainably built. When we cultivate good health internally - we radiate that positivity externally. That's why Obi is committed to delivering delicious, fun and affordable health products for everyone - a healthy and happy life is everybody's birthright.

Probiotics are amazing microorganisms that naturally exist in the body and perform critical functions to keep us alive and healthy. Our ancestors consumed them for thousands of years in the form of probiotic ferments but, unfortunately, theyâ€™ve been largely eliminated from our modern diet. Probiotics have been clinically indicated as helping to support digestive function, the immune system and many other aspects of health - and exciting new research is constantly unearthing new probiotic benefits!

We decided to use water kefir because itâ€™s a potent non-dairy probiotic thatâ€™s been consumed by people for thousands of years. Our unique fermentation process creates a refreshing, smooth kefir that utilizes 20 different kinds of strains that work powerfully as a team.

We explored hundreds of different flavor pairings of organic juices and cold-pressed flavor extracts and even developed a proprietary stevia-based sweetener because nothing currently on the market met our taste and quality standards. Obi is not only probiotic and delicious, but also low in calories and sugar.

After five years in development and many late nights in our organic food kitchen, we are excited to share Obi with the world! Our goal has been to create a drink for all of us, because we shouldnâ€™t have to choose between something healthy and something delicious.

20 kinds of living water kefir probiotics; Certified USDA Organic; Less than 20 calories; No artificial sweeteners. Gluten-free; Caffeine-free; Vegan/Dairy-free.

Obi goes above and beyond in delivering top quality probiotics in a delicious organic soda.

LIVE Kombucha Soda is 99% raw, organic kombucha

but it tastes like the popular brands of soda you crave!

LIVE Soda Kombucha began in Austin, Texas as one man's mission to improve the health of his family by crafting a kombucha that tastes like soda. Trevor Ross first experimented with small batches, tweaking spices and flavors until he got each one just right. His kombucha went above and beyond industry standards of quality and probiotic content using only the purest ingredients - always USDA Organic, Non-GMO, Fair-Trade, and 99% raw kombucha. Soon, friends and family were raving about the delicious taste and asking him to sell bottles of the brew. Trevor had already achieved great success with boundless nutrition and his yummy Oatmega Bars and Perfect Fit Protein Cookies, so he teamed up with his friends David Smith of sweet leaf tea and Mario Mendias of My Fit Foods to share LIVE Kombucha Soda with the world. Now this raw, organic beverage has come on the market, much to the delight of soda and kombucha lovers alike. Try it! Your digestive tract will thank you.

ï»¿

OogavÃ© believes you deserve better. Part of that credo is pulling back the curtain so you know exactly where your soda comes from.

Agave is a succulent plant native to Mexico. There are four major parts of the agave that are edible. The leaves may be collected in winter and spring for eating, when the plants are rich in sap. Each agave plant will produce several pounds of edible flowers during its final season. The stalks, which are ready before the blossom, can be eaten like sugarcane. Finally, the sap, called aguamiel or â€˜honeywaterâ€™, is used to make the organic agave nectar we use to sweeten our soda.

Oogave uses only light premium organic Weber blue agave. Blue agave requires little cultivation, so it is ideal for organic certification. It requires little water and no pesticides, herbicides of fertilizers. It is ready for harvest in seven years.

The skilled men who conduct the harvest are called Jimadores. Harvest requires not only great knowledge of the plant and being mindful of the spines of the leaves, but also expertise in wielding the sharp, spade-like knife called the coa.

After harvest, the leaves of the plant are left on the ground to compost, becoming soil nutrition for the next generation. The remaining pinas or â€˜pineapplesâ€™ are then hauled out of the fields by truck, or if the terrain necessitates, burros.

The pina trucks are then taken to one of the agave production facilities. There, the pinas are unloaded and fed into a machine that shreds them into a pulp.

The pulp is then placed into a machine known as a diffuser. The diffuser uses hot water and steam to extract the juice from the plant. The remainder of the plant, mostly cellulose, is perfect farm animal feed. The agave juice is then pumped into huge vats. The vats are heated to 190 degrees F for a period of 36 hours in a process called heat hydrolysis. The heat breaks down the natural inulin into simple sugars.

When the hydrolysis is finished, the juice is then passed through filters to remove any plant materials or other impurities. After filtration, the juice consists of 15% sugar and inulin, and 85% moisture. To reduce the moisture content to only 25%, the juice is put into an evaporator. The evaporator is a very tall structure that pulls the moisture out using a vacuum pump. The end result is delicious agave nectar.

The agave nectar is tested by an on-site laboratory to ensure the highest standards of quality. It is then placed into drums and sealed for its trip to our plant in Colorado.

The agave arrives at our facilities in sealed numbered drums. Each drum is clearly labeled, and all the proper paperwork is always provided so that we can trace the organic agave nectar in every bottle of Oogave back to the day it was produced.

The organic agave nectar is then pumped into large mixing tanks. Once there, we add the natural flavors extracts and citric acid to create the base syrup for whichever flavor we are making that day.

After the syrup is thoroughly mixed to ensure consistency, it is pumped into a machine called the carbo-mixer. This machine proportions the syrup with our triple filtered Colorado water. It is then force carbonated to add the bubbles to make our soda pop! The resulting carbonated soda is then placed in a pressurized holding tank before heading into the bottle filler.

Â 

The bottles themselves arrive from the manufacturer fresh from the furnace. We then take the extra step of rinsing them one last time before they are filled.Â The bottles are then fed into the filler, which is our 1961 Meyer Dumore 40 head filler affectionately known as â€˜Brass Bettyâ€™. The bottles are lifted up to the filling head, pressurized with CO2, and then filled with the great flavor of the day.

The bottles are then rinsed again on the outside and dried by powerful air knives before being labeled. They are finally hand-packed in the individual four packs and case boxes for sale around the World.

Oogave is made as pure and as real as Mother Nature intended. You deserve a soda this good, give one a tryâ€¦Cheers!

Cola, rediscovered

Really? You say soda can be good for you?


Pull up a chair and letâ€™s dish. Back in the day, cola was developed as an elixir to help aid what ailed us. Drinks like ginger ale and root beer were actually made from real herbs to soothe a sick stomach. Back then, ingredients were free of chemicals and anything artificial - just pure and natural refreshment. Flash forward almost 100 years, and now soft drinks contain artificial flavorings, sweeteners and preservatives along with phosphoric acid, reportedly linked to bone loss and other not-so-good side effects.

Weâ€™re bringing cola back to its natural roots, to a place where refreshment lives up to its name. Natureâ€™s Pure contains nothing artificial - no added sodium, and USDA certified organic ingredients. For those of us who enjoy our bottle of fizz, that sounds and tastes a whole lot better. Natureâ€™s Pure. Savor the flavor.

Natures Pure is the only USDA Certified Organic Cola made with the best ingredients from the most exotic locations around the world. Sip slowly and savor the flavor, in the glass bottle.

One sip of our Natureâ€™s Pure cola out of a glass bottle and you may just hear yourself saying, now thatâ€™s what Iâ€™m talking about â€“ delicious and clean tasting.
